description:
This is our goto place for Italian food. 
Pastas, pizzas, everything on the menu really, it's all great stuff. 

My wife loves the gnocchi, my kids always goes for the lasagna.
author: Jorge B.

description:
It's been a long time (years) since I've eaten here. The quality of the food has definitely gone downhill. During this visit we started with the antipasto misto for two and for entrees ordered the squid ink risotto with seafood and the gnocchi with gorgonzola cream sauce. The appetizer was fine, it had 4 pieces of cheese, 4 toasted slices of baguette and 6 pieces of cold cuts draped over arugula. I thought it was overpriced for what we got. 

Our entrees came out maybe 25 min after the appetizer was cleared. It was a loooong wait and we saw the waiter specifically ask the cook where our food was. When it finally did arrive without any acknowledgement of the long wait we were underwhelmed. The gnocchi were really heavy vs light and fluffy and the sauce was a little too thick. The risotto was topped with shrimp and scallops. The rice itself tasted good, but not creamy like other risottos. The scallop tasted off like it had a very alkaline taste to it. We thought perhaps because it was an old frozen scallop that perhaps had a lot of preservatives - so it was left on the plate. 

We also came home with a bit of a tummy ache. After this visit, I think we'll stick with our regular Italian spot up the street.  On the plus side, their wine pours are generous and the restaurant itself seems very kid friendly.
author: Angelito R.

description:
We went to dinner here during the week and got right in. I am a bit torn on my review...the food was amazing as was the wine. Our service was amazing when we could get it. I had the mushroom ravioli and the BF had their lasagna and we both absolutely loved our meal. The wine was great for the BF who drank his and mine after the waiter brought me something more to my liking (I asked if they had something with a bit more spice to it and he knew just what to bring - a 2013 Nebbiolo from Piemonte). 
Now, let me say a few things about the service in general; I was on crutches and on my way back from the restroom upon our arrival when a bus boy AND a waitress pushed past me (the waitress actually stepped on my foot as she pushed past me) just to get to the table I was JUST about to pass. After the waitress stepped on my foot, it wasn't until I stopped, hesitating taking a sec to collect myself so I didn't just go off on her, did she turn around realizing what she did and apologized. It was too late by that point. I was hoping this gal wasn't going to be our waitress...she wasn't. We had a very nice, knowledgeable gentleman instead. 
The other thing was that we had finished our small glasses of waters we were given upon our arrival and we couldn't for the life of us get anyone's attention to refill our glasses. We did catch the eye of the man who was at the brick oven but he never did alert anyone to our needs that we know of. Finally someone did come by, bringing us a carafe of water so that we could pour our own as needed. 
After these 2 incidents, everything else was lovely...well except the constant phone ringing behind my head. We were seated at a table right up front near a window which we thought would be nice but didn't realize that a phone with a pretty obnoxious ringer would be in my ear during the whole dinner. That did not make for a pleasant atmosphere. 
We would go to this place again but with the previous experience in the back of our mind. Don't sit up front by the window, it's not the best place to come if you have are on crutches or can't get up and down their aisle to and from their restroom quickly and ask for the water carafe in the beginning just in case.
author: Michelle F.

description:
My friends and I stopped by after a day in SF and were thoroughly impressed. This cozy restaurant serves a variety of authentic Italian dishes and offers quite a few vegetarian options. Our server, Niko, was friendly and welcoming, and made us feel right at home. We ordered the Handmade Porcini Mushroom Ravioli, the Eggplant Parmigiana, the Uovo pizza, and the Nutellino. 

The Handmade Porcini Mushroom Ravioli was our favorite dish of the night. The black truffle cream sauce was phenomenal. The truffle flavor was prominent but not overpowering, and the sauce was rich and creamy. The ravioli was chewy, with a delicious mushroom filling, but the sauce was something else. Definitely worth coming back for.

I also enjoyed the Eggplant Parmigiana. The eggplant was tender and flavorful, and went well with the delicious red sauce and savory cheese. All the ingredients melded perfectly.

The Uovo pizza was a bit disappointing. This pizza is topped with egg, pancetta, wild mushroom, and buffalo mozzarella. We ordered it without the pancetta because my friend is vegetarian, and probably lost a lot of flavor by doing so. The crust was pillowy and airy, but the flavors didn't stand out and the runny egg kept falling off when we tried to eat the pizza. :/ It's probably best not to tamper with the original recipe.

For dessert, we ordered the Nutellino, which is a homemade calzone stuffed with Nutella chocolate. The light, fluffy crust was stuffed with rich and gooey Nutella. Even though we were stuffed, we couldn't stop eating because it was so good. Our waiter also gave us a complementary slice of tiramisu. The tiramisu tasted pretty traditional to me, and I liked that it wasn't too sweet.

We came here on a Saturday around 8 pm. The restaurant was busy, but we were seated right away. We found a metered spot pretty easily (free because it was late). The ambiance is cozy and lively, and the service is amazing. Our server even asked us for our names at the end of the meal. I wish the portion size of the Mushroom Ravioli and the Eggplant Parmigiana were a bit larger, especially since both were so delicious, but the huge Uovo pizza made up for it. Adding dessert on top of that, we all left stuffed. If you're ever in the area, stop by for authentic Italian food and the friendliest servers!

Food - 4/5
Ambiance - 4/5
Service - 5/5
author: Lilith H.

description: Excellent food, the nicest people, & as important, outdoor seating with A grade heating!  Spaghetti al dente, meatballs cooked slowly in tomato sauce, superb.  Margareta pizza was perfect!  Be sure to dip crust in chili oil.  OMG.  Might as well try the tiramisu for the Italian touch.  Neighborhood restaurant that we are more than willing to cross a number of neighborhoods to eat at.  Kinga made an already delicious dinner even more enjoyable .
author: Patrick C.

description: Third time here... Came here for Mason's 6th bday....wonderul awesome service ...definitely kid friendly. Great for family, small and big groups. They always try their best to accommodate plus food service is fast . Their food never disappoint. Its so good and authentic. If you haven't been than must try. Usually im good at pin pointing my fave but this time I love all the dishes I had. FYI our server is great and handsome.
author: Christy V.

description:
4 stars for the overall food, but 5 stars for the dining experience. 

We ordered:
1. Burrata cheese and 24 month aged San Daniele prosciutto (Brusschetta) $11 for 6 pieces 
- One word, AMAZING!! This was WAY better than expected and simply blew my mind. Not sure if it's the cheese or ham, but the overall combination was D E L I C I O U S!!! Loved and would definitely recommend this as an appetizer. 

2. Spaghetti Carbonara $18
- I'm a huge fan of carbonara, but this wasn't what I expected. Yes, it's a good portion, but there was something about the flavor that tasted different. It's definitely unique? I've never seen a carbonara with a sunny side egg on top either. Interesting. 

3. Fiocchetti $19
- I only had one bite, so I couldn't make the best judgment, but my friend said it wasn't salty enough. The bread and bruschetta was pretty filling so we both didn't finish our entrees. 

Service was excellent. Such friendly staff and a nice gentleman that served us. Water was always checked on and we never had an issue grabbing his attention. He even gave us complimentary dessert at the end!! We were the very last customers, so we totally appreciated that he stayed a little later until we finished. 

Interior ambiance was romantic. We didn't think it'd look that fancy! Candles on each table and the lights are a little dim. Loved it!! There's also outdoor seating :)
author: Miranda T.

description: My boyfriend had the meatballs and sauce appetizer while I had the burrata caprese. Nothing to write home about for the meatballs- sauce was super tasty though. Burrata was alright but it was covered in to much balsamic reduction to even have its own flavor profile. Large pours of red wine was a plus. Will have to come back for some main courses...
author: Carly A.

description:
AMBIANCE: The restaurant looks like a great date place. My friend and I arrived at 7:30pm on a Monday and this place was already packed. There was a table outside under heated lamps so we sat there and luckily it wasn't cold at all!

FOOD: I got the San Daniele pizza (prosciutto, arugula, tomato, mozzarella) which costs $18. The pizza was HUGE and it made 3 servings. Very tasty, and the crust wasn't bad either. I would highly recommend this pizza to share. I also tried a bite of my friend's lasagna and that was very delicious also.

SERVICE: Exceeded beyond my expectations! Our water was never empty, and our waiter (or maybe owner) PLUS the bus boy made sure that everything was okay. Impressive, especially since we were sitting outside which outside tables usually gets neglected.
author: Julian Y.

description:
Looking for delicious Italian served by Italians at a very reasonable price in a nice yet casual atmosphere? This is a great choice.  

When we walked in, we heard people speaking Italian immediately.  When our waiter greeted us, it was with a thick Italian accent.  As people left they loudly called back in Italian. This, combined with a pretty entrance,  really made it a fun experience right away for a couple families visiting from out of town.

Prompt service, along with a friendly and fun waiter!  They were very good with the kids.  They brought out yummy crusty bread and some very good quality olive oil. They kept bring out more as we needed it too. Lovely! 

I asked what was vegan, and after some Italian/English translation, was advised to order spaghetti marinara with mushrooms. 

Our food came out surprisingly fast and it was piping hot.  The portions were huge.  My spaghetti was excellent. Everyone else at the table really enjoyed what they ordered too.  In fact, one friend, who grew up with parents from Italy said the lasagna was best he had eaten in a very long time.  Now that is a big compliment from this guy!
author: Stef M.

description:
Trattoria da Vittorio brought me back to Italy while still close to home. Menu was short, sweet and to the point. I started with the caprese con burrata salad which was topped with an amazing balsalmic vinaigarette.

For the main, I had to try the porcini mushroom ravioli with black truffle cream sauce. This dish was so decadent and rich, I was eating as slow as possible. I didn't want this dish to end!

I also got to try the veal scalopinni with a rock marsala sauce which was so rich, best if shared. Tried the profitorals with whipped cream but I thought it could be better. It was everyone's birthday that night so it was a bit busy but hey, they sang for my brother Samy's birthday too, so it was all good.

Mixed reviews from my family but overall, everyone had a good time. I can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu.
author: Hala A.

description: Order 7 items for takeout. The condition they were delivered appeared to be as an instance where the food is dropped to the floor and repacked.
author: Ariel S.

description:
Don't understand all these high ratings. 
Average food.

Order the fried clamari and organic artichoke.  Very disppointed. Tastless, underseason. The sauces seems like it just pour out of a bottle. Tartar sauce claims to be "homemade". Must have been by a 5yr old.  Marinara was bland. 
Had a 3 seafood and vegetable dish that was recommend by the waiter. Salmon was excellent. The other fish you can forget! Asparagus was excellent.
Porcini mushrooms were good. The dough seems like a "wonton" wrapper
Salsiccia pizza was average. Had better.  
The bus person was in a rush to get us to leave.
author: wayman w.

description:
Went here for lunch today. Overall, decent Italian place. Service was meh- we had to ask for hot water with lemon 4 times before the waiter finally brought it. 

We started with the organic kale salad, which was average, nothing special. For entrees my friend got the porcini mushroom raviolis, which were good, but the order only comes with 6 raviolis on the plate. My grandma had the spaghetti with meatballs. They have gluten free pasta for gluten free guests. I don't eat meat, so they created a truffle cream sauce pasta, gluten free for me, which was very good. 

Portions aren't huge, so definitely recommend ordering a couple things if you're really hungry. 

Pictures of what we ordered below
author: Kim B.

description: The service wasn't the best as waiters came by only to take orders and not to offer more bread or a refill on our water. But, the saving grace was the food. I absolutely adored the gnocchi. The tiramisu to me wasn't the best, but instead was mediocre. That said, it came out pricy but the flavors of the food made it pretty much worth it.
author: None Of Y.

description:
Overhyped! Everyone on Yelp gets the wild boar ragu which looked really good. The noodles were made perfectly but the sauce was so salty. I had some of the lasagna, that was much more flavorful and tasty. If they used the lasagna red sauce for the wild boar ragu, that would have been much tastier. The bruschetta was good but nothing to rave about. 

Only come for the atmosphere, food...maybe we didn't make the best choices. I much prefer Spiazzo across the street.
author: Kylie L.

description:
service: 5 stars. super friendly and attentive service
Salad: 5 stars,  I had ceasar salad.  was one of the best I hve had.  
antipasto: 3 stars,  nothing quite special about it..
bread: 2 stars,  was ok.. had better fresh bread at other italian res..
entree: 3 stars.. from the pic I saw, we ordered carbonara.   onion overpowered the cremy, eggy texture.  interestingly they put sunnyside egg over the spaghetti.. after asking for extra cheese and pepper, it tasted bit better, but it still was not the tasty, creamy carnabora..

The res seems to attract a lot of people from the neighborhood, which I think is great!  the owner seems to know people and very friendly.
I would like to go back to try other dishes and hope to share a better tasting experience.
author: Sona K.

description:
We went back to Trattoria da Vittorio and it was really good. The Bella pizza (with the burrata) was really tasty ! We ordered the special for appetizer which was really good too. 
The tiramisu for desert: perfect 
I will go back !
author: Laetitia V.

description:
There was a 45 minute wait but it felt like only 20 minutes. The restaurant isn't that big, the music was loud and you can be sure that it was crowded on Valentine's Day! I ordered the homemade scialatielee pasta pescatora. It's pasta with a red sauce and seafood. I enjoyed the seafood a lot, like the shrimp and clam. The red sauce didn't have much of a taste. 
I'm disappointed of how loud this restaurant was. The music was so loud that I felt like I was sitting at a nightclub. It was hard for me to hear my partner speak. Overall, the food was okay and the service wasn't bad but it wasn't the best because the waiter didn't even refill our water or check up on us. I understand that it was such a busy day. I hope that the next time I try their food again that it'll be better.
author: Kristi A.

description:
Wonderful casual Italian place with variety menu, family environment but good for date night. Wood oven pizzas and fresh risotto and fish of the day specials are always yummy, we've gone here often and been impressed with the friendly attentive waiters and quality of the food. Great addition to the west portal
Hood!
author: Jennifer R.

description:
We headed here after another place we wanted to go had a wait of over 2 hours. Parking is indeed atrocious. And they don't take reservations over the phone. And the bar is considered seating, so you can't sit at the bar while you wait. But do not let any of that deter you. This place is amazing!

It's is small. Quite small. So you will be a tad cramped. But it's not a bad cramped. It's a cute, Italian restaurant kind of cramped. It adds to the ambiance and vibe. And it somehow still manages to almost feel intimate.

The hostess and other staff were quite friendly. We were offered glasses of wine while we waited, etc. And out wait wound up being way less time than initially estimated. We were seated at the bar, which was fine by us.

Our server was legit Italian. Super friendly and knowledgeable. And despite the lengthy waitlist, we never felt rushed.

The wine list is plenty. The menu has many offerings. Naturally, we couldn't resist the pasta dishes. Barbara S. had the lasagna and proclaimed it the best she's ever had. I opted for the cheese one with the pasta filled with pear. So unique and yum! The pear was subtle. Just enough sweetness and variance to counteract the cheesy goodness. And such fresh pasta! It was absolutely a memorable dish. And both dishes were quite filling. They weren't overly large, but they were challenging to come close to finishing them.

Come eat here! You won't be disappointed. This was some of the best pasta I've experienced since returning from trip to Italy. And I think that's saying a lot.
author: Samantha G.

description:
Combo bruschetta, Salmon Special, pasta special. 
Amazing, amazing, amazing. Did I mention...Amazing? 
They really care about their food and patrons here. The flavors and service are my favorite things about this gem. 
Always looking forward to my next meal here!
author: Jasmine C.

description:
Went out on date night with my boyfriend and decided to give this spot a try. Walked in got seated very quickly for the place looking pretty busy for a wednesday night. Food was really good. We ordered the pomodori bruschetta and the san daniele pizza. Both were out super quick! I would say the bruschetta could have had more fresh cut tomatoes, they were a little mushy for my liking. But still really flavorful. 

Our server was really sweet and checked up on us periodically. Our water was never empty and the plates were taken once they were done. Oh, and we tried the tiramisu... it was delicious!! *drool* 

Overall, I highly recommend here!
author: Bailey R.

description: 3.5 stars rounded up. We ordered takeout. The spaghetti meatballs was okay. The salad was fresh and decent. I'll order something else to try again.
author: Benz S.

description: My meal was like a cheap diner entree, management lacks professionalism, and this location carries a health score of 81 (as of the time of this review). 81, according to the SFDPH, is classified as "needs improvement," and is issued when "several significant" violations are observed. I've been in some filthy places with higher scores than 81.
author: James D.

description:
I'm not exactly sure how to rate this place. The appetizers were amazing. We had the combination bruschetta and that was on point! The entries were good but not particularly special IMO. We got Prosciutto Risotto, Fiocchetti, and Lasagne. The Fiocchetti was probably the best out of the three. The risotto felt a bit undercooked - the rice can be really hard sometimes. Also, they need to work on their presentation for that dish, the flailing purple cabbages were not much of a decoration...

The service was good. Our waiter was very attentive and food came out pretty fast. We decided to sit outside due to the wait for tables indoors. It turned out to be a great choice. With the heater hanging above us, we felt very warm and comfortable :)

Our bill came out to be ~$120 after tax/tip for 3 people and we didn't even have any drinks. It's kind of pricy if you ask me, so I'm not sure if I would come back again given that the food wasn't super impressive either.
author: Angel C.

description: It was great! A must visit. The seats and table was a bit uncomfortable but the pizza and wine were delicious. I wanted to order fish but it was Meat-less Monday. So, maybe next time! Server was friendly and knowledgeable.  Thank you!
author: Tippy T.

description:
This is a rocking eatery in a swanky neighborhood. The waitstaff are superbly attentive and scan their section regularly, indicating with great eye contact, nods and thumbs ups, that they have really seen you and had an opportunity to request something. Look like you have a question, and they come your direction. The place is banging after 6:30pm even on a Thursday night--there was a line going out the door!

The pizzaiola was so quick in making pie that I could barely get a shot of the regular pie but not the cute mickey mouse one. 

The fire breathing oven is a cheery red, and the wine is lovely. The half bottle is not more than two regular single glasses, so unless you really like the selection, go with a single glass or dive into a bottle!

A diner sharing the bar had split an order of risotto to share as a pair. Brilliant.

We thought the brussel sprouts with gorgonzola and pancetta was dangerously addictive--swabbing the sauce with bread until it was spotless.

The eggplant parmagiana was a carefully choreographed dish that was contiguous, comforting but not flashy. The velvety veal scallopini had tender, sheets of mild flesh that was succulent without being slimy The mushrooms were juicy but still had bite The spinach was tender without being tinny. The cauliflower was tender and sweet. But it was that decadent sauce... the perfect sauce that teetered on gravy--yes, more bread was in order to sop it all up. 

Perfect vibe for date night--full house, attentive service, comforting food, cool evening.
author: Lu-Shien T.

description: Delicious italian!  really really good, i was happy to find a little authentic spot next to the university of San Francisco!!!
author: Giselle B.

description:
The food here is amazing. This is in West Portal in San Francisco. Parking is atrocious. We parked 3 blocks away in a residential neighborhood. We were somehow lucky enough to have them accommodate a group of 12 on a Saturday night. We only waited 30 minutes. We got so lucky because after we ate there were many groups waiting. (sorry!) 

I had the homemade fioticcini. It's cheeses were so delicious, HOWEVER, for some... you will NOT like the pear that they add to it.  It was definitely unusual. I didn't hate it. However, I did not love it either. The combo is surprisingly great. However it was too much for me after finishing the whole dish. Pear is very unusual in pasta. It's a hit or miss for some. 

I had a sampler of the Bruschetta's and I really enjoyed all of them. I have no idea what each one was called, but the one made of some sort of nut or legume was really good. The tomato one seemed very basic, but I actually really liked it. The other appetizer we had was the meat slice with cheeses. That I could definitely pass on. I would rather enjoy eating the calamari ;) 

My boyfriend got the dinner special: Lamb chops with truffle gnocci. This gnocci is THICK. I like smaller gnocci because it has a much better sauce to potato ratio. The surface area is increased and makes it so much better. :) The lamb chops were medium rare, perfect for me because it wasn't too bloody. It's a bit salty, BUT I LOVE IT! I WOULD GET THIS HANDS DOWN because I love lamb chops. I may want to see if I can substitute the gnocci because I didn't enjoy it as much as I thought I would. But the truffle sauce is amazing :) Much love to it. 

Staff was so friendly and sweet. The owner stopped by the various tables and the staff personally knew and greeted their regulars. This restaurant is costly, but the atmosphere and food are great. It's loud, but you can hold a conversation. Not too bright or dark. I would come here again to try something else and definitely take a close friend, family member, or significant other here for a special night. Probably the biggest shortcoming is that this place is so small and cramped. There's only enough space for one-way traffic so customers and employees are dodging each other between tables just to get through. Still love it! Ciao!
author: Michelle Y.

description:
I'm not sure why there are so many favorable four and five star reviews on here for this place.  Have come several times since they took over the space from Cafe For All Seasons.  Although we did like the place when it first opened, we noticed that the quality and freshness of the food just wasn't there for us to warrant being return customers.  I ordered the lasagna once and it was lukewarm in the middle, making me assume it was just re-heated (which I get - lasagna takes a long time to make - but at least serve it hot).  The romaine lettuce in my Caesar salad was a little brown, some of the other ingredients in the other dishes didn't scream fresh, and the staff can seem very unfriendly at times, leading us to feel very underwhelmed with our overall experience.

Reading some of the reviews on here just kind of boggles my mind.  Makes me wonder if they have been deprived!  Some say it's the best Italian they've ever had and it's the best in the city.  Wow!  Makes me wonder if they've ever been to places like Perbacco, La Ciccia, Cotogna, A16, etc. Just because they speak Italian at the restaurant doesn't make the food taste better!
author: Jesus H.

description: Authentic Italian food .  Michelin rated! Need I say more? The gnocchi was made in a special portobello mushroom  sauce.
author: Erika L.

description:
Authentic Italian food great service and amazing all around night! 
We are in San Francisco visiting family and called to make reservations as there were going to be 12 of us for dinner.  Although this particular Restaurant didn't take reservations they accommodated us with just an hours notice.  Our waiter was attentive, super helpful and from Italy! 
We ordered the burrata salad for an app for the table the tomatoes were fresh the burrata was creamy and perfect and the dish was athletically pleasing.  For dinner we ordered the lasagna the pizza and a side of meatballs.  EVERYTHING was cooked to perfection and everyone in our party was very impressed.  Dinner was excellent I hope to be back soon!
author: Lauren H.

description:
I just got some takeout from here to get some authentic Italian cuisine:
Fiocchetti - Handmade Pasta stuffed with 3 Italian cheese, pear in gorgonzola cream sauce
This dish was pretty tasty but I don't think I'd get it again. The pear made it taste kinda funny to me.

They threw some bread and chili peppers in the to-go bag (not sure if it normally comes with it). The people who served me, for the few minutes I was in the building, were nice.

The only bad thing about this place is that it's on the pricey side. For handmade noodles though, might be worth it!
author: Marlon T.

description:
I was requested to go to this Italian restaurant in west portal.
I went in and sat down at the counter during lunch it wasn't crowded four or five tables. I ask the waiter for a glass of red wine (House) and a menu for take out. While I reviewed the menu I sipped on the below average tasteless wine a good house wine. Came across what dish was requested. Order the dish and watch the so call cafeteria cooks
prep my dish again no good smells of Italian food being cook from the closet (warming up closet). As they were pouring the rav's into a paper box and into a paper box along with four slices of bread I finished the house wine paid the bill and left. A glass (bottle 24.00) of house red wine for 12.00 bucks along with that six (2.66) ravioli for 16.00.
Got to my friends house drop off the meal she took one look at the food and gave it to her dog to eat. She ask me to go and pick up a pizza in west portal which was good.
author: Observer T.

description: This is our family "go to" spot in West Portal.  Vittorio and his staff are extremely welcoming, the food is great and the wine variety is fantastic.  Our daughters' love his spaghetti and meatballs, with an extra meatball and we enjoy everything on the menu.
author: Rachelle C.

description:
I've been wanting to stop by here since they took over the space that housed Cafe For All Seasons.  We  finally came in on a cold, rainy school night when the restaurant the kids had picked out wasn't open and I'm glad we did!

We were seated right away without reservations, though the restaurant was busy.  Niccolo, our server, was warm, attentive, and patient as I kept adding items to our order over dinner.  Good selection of items on the kids menu and happy we were able to add side orders of cooked vegetables (most places have raw carrots or steamed broccoli at best). Pizza cooked in a fire oven.  Meatballs were delicious and flavorful.  Food arrived quickly and I also appreciated the diverse listing of reasonably priced wines by the glass.

Warm, cozy ambience (family friendly without it feeling like a kids' restaurant) and friendly maitre 'd are two other reasons we'll definitely be back!
author: M G.

description: Had lunch there today and was very disappointed. The calamari was chewy and lacked flavor. I ordered the meatball panini and it was literally cold. Fries were cold and soggy. My friend ordered a steak panini and it was also cold, fatty, and tough. Not to mention the steak was only on one side of the panini, she couldn't even finish eating it, nor could I. The wine was good and so was the service, but I won't be eating here again. Not to mention having to look at the couple at the bar with his hands down his partners pants, crack and all showing. Gross
author: Monique C.

description:
After living here for almost two years, Italian food in another part of San Francisco that isn't North Beach down right strange. However, this little spot manages to hold its own, even if it's overmatched. 

I came here for lunch since work is close enough to walk. They have a fairly large menu and after some consideration, I went with he two-piece combo chicken Milanese and eggplant parmigiana.  Both were good separately, although I would have preferred some tomato sauce over my chicken. They offered ketchup so that's how I knew my meal wasn't truly Italian. Before the main course, I had stuffed myself full of carbs with a few slices of the variety bruschetta. I highly would recommend this to start your meal as it's quite the treat. Best one? The salmon or original.

For a party of 10 of us, the wait staff had good memory on who had what and our orders came out at the same time. It was also a celebratory lunch so our boss took care of the bill so that was a pleasant surprise! Lessons learned; Italian-like food can be had anywhere and always attend group lunches with your boss.
author: Quoc N.

description:
Authentic Italian food with a side of amazing customer service. We started off with the appetizer, Caprese con Burrata. I ordered the gnocchi with Gorgonzola cream sauce, and my friend ordered the squid ink pasta with seafood in tomato sauce. Both were very delicious and filling. 

We had some dessert Nutellino (delicious baked  Nutella  Calzone), totally worth the calories, with tea and a cappuccino.

We were well taken care of by the friendly, helpful staff. We will definitely come back to try the pizza. 

Great place for a fancy date and is a bit pricy, but for me worth it. 

They don't take reservations and can get fairly busy during the dinner hour.
author: Ro N.

description: Consistently good and friendly staff...the pasta is made perfectly al dente and the sauces are not overwhelming.  We live nearby and whenever we want Italian this is our go to spot. It's hands down better than spiazzo (down the street).
author: Marsha L.

description:
Craving quality Italian food for my annual "cousins night out," my sister recommended Trattoira da Vittorio. I've passed by this place 100s of times but I've never really noticed it. As we waited for our table, the waiters gave us all a complimentary glass of wine. We were shortly seated and our waiter was very thorough explaining the menu and patient answering our questions. I was able to try a few dishes: 

1. Lasagna: Absolutely delicious. The portion was huge and each bit was extremely cheesy with huge chunks of meat. The noodle was cooked perfectly. One of the best Lasagna I've ever had.

2.  Cioppino: Wasn't on the menu but one of the specials for the day. It was SOOO good. Big piece of lobster claw, crab, clams, fish and shrimp. The sauce was delicious and I kept dipping bread to soak it up. 

3. Calamari: Perfectly fried and the squid was fresh. I also liked that they had pieces of fried artichoke. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Overall this restaurant had a perfect trifecta of exemplary service, perfect ambiance and delicious food. To top it off, it was my cousins birthday so they had a wonderful surprise for her after our dinner. They had someone come out with a trumpet and played happy birthday for her and gave her the most amazing tiramisu. I couldn't have asked for a better dinner. This place is a must try. The prices are very fair (most entrees about $15-25 and specials around $30). I will definitely be back!
author: Jonathan L.

description: Was craving Italian and this place hit the damn spot! Can't remember what I got due to whiskey shots at local bars. Wait I think it was kinda ravioli-esque. Maybe some wine too.
author: Rob R.

description: One of our neighborhood favorites! We are pizza connoisseurs and it doesn't get much better than TdV. Our favorite is a half salsiccia / half margarita which is scrumptious with a Caesar salad and cold peroni. Fresh pastas are amazing, too, we're just creatures of habit. Service is excellent, adding to the authentic Italian experience. The team has minimal turn-over and they take pride in their work while having a good time with guests. ‍
author: Max M.

description:
I can't rave enough about this place. The food is a 10. And the service is bar none. I'd give it a 20 if I could. They even import the flour for the pizza from Napoli. Wow!! 
Giovanni has to be the best manager. He really goes the extra mile to make you feel taken care of. 
If I lived next door to this place I'd gain a ton because I wouldn't be able to stay away.
author: Katrina S.

description:
3.5 Stars.

Sometimes ambiance and service can win a yelper over.

The food here is just okay. The fried calamari was somewhat rubbery. The Cesar Salad was okay but nothing special.

The pastas are something one could cook at home with a little effort. Wish I had ordered the Lasagna as that looked wonderful!

Pizza's were probably the shining star.

But this place is such a cozy place to dine. Service is really great.

If you need to get away from your kitchen Trattoria Da Vittorio is a good choice.
author: David G.

description: The food was absolute delicious. Waiter was very friendly, and the food came out fast. What more could you want?! The mushroom ravioli with truffle sauce was excellent, perfect for a light meal.
author: Matt S.

description: Had this delivered and everything we tried was very good. The eggplant Parmesan was our favorite, it wasn't bitter or tough and the red sauce was perfect. The mushroom truffle ravioli was also very good. The gnocchi was fresh as was the pesto sauce but the sauce was herbaceous and needed salt (which I never say)! I don't salt my food but this could've been improved with salt or parmesan. The bread was the only disappointing item- dry and just not good. I love that it came with sides of fresh Parm and crushed red peppers. I would definitely recommend this restaurant if you are over in that area and I would choose it if over in that neck of the woods. I would try the spaghetti because their red sauce is very good. The delivery fee is just too steep to get it delivered though... the only reason I was able to is a free delivery coupon!
author: Piper W.

description: The food is outstanding, hands down. Will come back again and again because of the food. The service except for Orlando is unacceptable. We were handed menus with no words. Then asked what we want. No introduction, no hello, no ask if we want drinks, we felt like the waiters wanted to be anywhere else but there.  We had to yell at him what we want to drink as he walked away.  Giovanni and another tall slim waiter who spoke even less. It bordered on rude. Orlando the bus boy made the place. Very friendly, checked on us, asked if everything was ok, great personality. We wanted to tip him only.
author: Denyse H.

description: Yesterday I bought pasta from here the red sauce taste like the brand of costco but I like the meatballs they were very delicious :D
author: Jennifer B.

description:
wow, so incredibly disappointing. i ordered the spaghetti meatballs and can't believe it cost me $25 to get THAT delivered thru caviar, even without the delivery fee.

first, there was hardly any pasta- i was able to inhale the whole order in 3 minutes. but mostly, the spaghetti was dry and bland- the sauce left everything to be desired- there was hardly any of it and it was watery. it was also way too garlicky- garlic salt at that! zero fresh garlic or fresh parmesan. just the powdered Kraft kind!

i was very surprised how terrible it was given the good reviews, and especially because the staff are authentic enough that they actually speak italian. 

the only reason i gave them 2 stars is because the 2 people in the restaurant i talked to over the phone were so nice, and because the meatballs weren't bad.

i guess nothing will ever really compare to emmy's spaghetti shack. i thought that was now overpriced at $18 including tax and the SF whatever fee, but it's easily 10 times better than this.
author: Tornado G.

description: This place is amazing. The service was fantastic. The food came out quick but not too quick it was perfect. The Caprese was FANTASTIC like melt in your mouth. We ordered the Carbonara, the gnocchi and the mushroom ravioli and everything was so delicious and well done. They brought us dessert at the end and that was UNREAL. The caramel ice cream oh my gosh.
author: Jazlyn H.

description:
DONT LEAVE A ONE STAR REVIEW IF YOU ORDERED FROM DOORDASH PEOPLE 

simple as that, sorry if your Doordash experience sucked but blame them, not the source.

Now onto my dining experience!

I came with the family for a birthday celebration.....mine! I chose this restaurant for the sake of its cuisine, and because it is a hop, skip, and a jump away from my grandparent's house. I worry about them driving far places, and this was super close.

The restaurant does not take reservations, however, upon us calling and explaining how my grandfather is 90 years old and cannot wait in line for a table, they immediately accommodated our request and held a table for (6) at 5:30pm on a Saturday night.

We arrive to the restaurant and the manager (/owner?) seated us at our table, and made sure we were comfortable. 

Our server was very attentive and explained all the nightly specials, and took care in explaining a few dishes we had questions about. What I really appreciated was he would kneel down whenever my grandfather spoke, and he was patient and would speak directly to him - it was pure respect and I was blown away.

Oh, and we also ordered a ton of food.

We started with the fried calamari- which came out so quick I was shocked - I didn't even decide on my entree when it arrived.
We also ordered (2) kinds of bruschetta for the table, one with burrata, arugula, and prosciutto, and another with cheese, smoked salmon, capers, and mustard. Delicious!

For entrees, we all had something different. We ordered:
-the dinner special Risotto, which was in a gorgonzola sauce and pancetta chopped up
-seafood pasta in a red sauce
-pizza with garlic, prosciutto, and arugula. THINNEST CRUST EVER
-Halibut special
-Rigatoni with peppers and sausage
-traditional spaghetti and meatballs

WOW. Everything was so good! In addition, we had (2) bottles of red wine for the table.

Unfortunately, no one wanted dessert except my grandmother and myself so we shared the Profiteroles and Caramel gelato desserts.

I was so stuffed at the end of such a huge meal. I walked to the car and fell asleep on the ride home.

It was such a great experience. They were so sweet and accommodating to our dining needs, and made sure we were comfortable and taken care of. 

This is a wonderful neighborhood restaurant that I will definitely dine at before the year ends.
author: Taylor M.

description:
Nice southern italian restaurant nestled in west portal. By far the most memorable dish we had was the Bruschetta combo. The bread along with all the other ingredients tasted fresh and very flavorful. I wasn't as enamored with the pasta which was fine but the sauce was...meh (think tomato paste) which threw the rest of the dish off. We tried the Nutella Calzone for dessert and agreed that it was inventive but that we could've probably made this exact dessert at home for a fraction of the cost. I would come back to try their lasagna and profiteroles as I noticed those dishes passing by our table and they looked delicious. Until next time Trattoria Da Vittorio. 

P.S. even though it was packed the service was very good.
author: Norris T.

description: Wouldn't call myself a pasta connoisseur, as the only pasta I really eat is the crappy quick 11 minute kind you make at college, but I have to say- that lunch was BOMB! I ordered the seafood pasta pescatora to go. Although I got takeout, I was welcomed by a really friendly server and he offered me a glass of water and offered me a menu. I sat down and the atmosphere of the entire restaurant was very lively with lights, mirrors, and all of those beautiful wine bottles lined up along the bar. :') I didn't want to leave. The pescatora was marvelous. Seafood was fresh and tasty. The red sauce had the right amount of spices and herbs that perfectly complemented the seafood. Also, the noodles had this fresh chewy texture that was great! It came with a few bread slides and parmesan. I liked the sauce too much so I dipped the bread in the extra sauce in it afterwards. Honestly would like to just have a huge bucket of that sauce and dip it in everything I eat. Had a great experience at this place and would recommend!
author: Ivy L.

description:
We come here often, it's just so easy and friendly and the food is good, too. It's often busy but the wait is usually not long. Service is very good, efficient without feeling rushed.
The food is good, seldom excellent. I like the wood fired pizza, the petrale sole and the lasagne. My husband really loves the eggplant parmesan.
 On the whole, we enjoy our dinners there. It's often our first choice when home cooking is not happening. We also came with our 4 yr old granddaughter who loved everything!
author: karen S.

description: The porcini mushroom ravioli literally brings me to tears it's so good. Came here 6 months ago for the first time, and made sure to come back just for that dish. Highly recommend if you're looking for Italian food in SF! SO GOOD
author: Lia I.

description: We ordered through DoorDash. The lasagna was ok but the rigatoni was so over cooked. It was gross and the sauce was watery with no flavor. Disappointing overall. Especially for the price.
author: Danielle H.

description:
Ive been coming here for years, and have never been let down with their service or quality of food. Recently I discovered Doordash, and today decided to treat myself to their personal sized margarita pizza and their beet salad (both Ive had many times before, and both usually delicious). 

The salad was a huge fail today. There were 2 strawberries, and three little pieces of beets. The dressing is usually olive oil and lemon, but today the lemon was missing in it.
author: Shira S.

description:
Trattoria da Vittorio ROCKS!

*Fantastic* service, affordable lunch specials and consistently delicious meals makes this place a must visit if you're in the West Portal area. 

Special shout out to Orlando who is the absolute best!!! Always five star service if he's there. Matteo rocks too- always goes above and beyond. :)
author: Pamela ..

description: Haven't had a bad meal yet in 3 visits. The eggplant parm is great and we love the burrata appetizer.
author: Jeff B.

description: Good food.  Food comes out very fast from the kitchen.   The pastas and sauce are from heaven.  I will come back.
author: D F.

description: My husband and I tried this place for dinner as they advertised gluten free pasta (for me). I got the gluten free pasta with the 3 Italian cheese, pear in Gorgonzola cream sauce and a glass of Pinot Noir. Im not sure I would come back for the dish I had, but my husband loved the Lasagna. He gives the lasagna 5 stars- it is a very generous portion. We knew this place would be expensive before we came, so we weren't surprised when the check came back. Just be prepared!
author: Kaitlyn N.

description: Nice little gem in West Portal. Friendly staff, fresh food, and warm atmosphere. Ordered the caprese con burrata and the bella pizza. The pizza came out first. It arrived with a layer of prosciutto and a handful of arugula with a dollop of burrata. I liked the dough it was just crisp enough to hold all the ingredients and doughy on the inside. The caprese was very good. The tomatoes were fresh, crisp and sweet. The balsamic drizzle added depth to the plate. All in all it was a good meal at a reasonable price.
author: Stephen Y.

description:
The food was pretty good. I had the gorgonzola gnocci, it was a large portion and good but nothing especially special. My dinner buddy had the veal, and he really liked the sauce. I thought the menu was good.

The best part was that we were seated right away at the bar and were able to watch the very awesome chef preparing the appetizers, salads, and deserts. The service was great and everyone seemed passionate about their work.
author: Sarah C.

description: Trattoria da Vittorio was a great find.  We found ourselves (traveling from multiple locations) in the City on the Saturday before Mother's Day and needed a place that could accommodate​ 9 bodies for an​ M.D. meal. I called other places that I found on Yelp and most were a "no-go​".  I called Trattoria da Vittorio and said yes.  They were able to seat right away. The menu provided items that fit everyone's​ taste.  Everything came out great!  Will definitely​ put Trattoria da Vittorio on our list!
author: Joe A.

description:
Quite the authentic Italian experience! 4 1/2 star for the Italian staff and real Italian cuisine! This was a lovely experience, as they seated us promptly, took our drink orders and then food order. Everything we ordered tasted great, I loved the Bella pizza. The fish special was very fresh and the mashed potato was to die for. We couldn't leave without an order of the Nutella calzone, with a double expresso... A sweet ending! 
Oh and did I mention the service.. Very pleasant, respectful and engaging. One was nicer than the next and not bad looking either!! ;) 
This is in a cute neighborhood, parking available all around. 

If I lived in the area I would go back more often.. It was however on the pricey side $25-$35p/p, worth every penny! 

Thank you for a wonderful italian experience!
author: Anie L.

description: Service was Friendly but slow. Overall the food was bland. Brussels sprouts were soggy, meatballs were underwhelming, pesto sauce for gnocchi had little flavor. Chicken Milano and Tiramisu were good.
author: Michael B.

description:
Good Italian food with Italian servers (well mine was!) Ate here twice, and I'd come again.

I've tried:
-Margherita pizza $15
-Salsiccia pizza $18
- Fiocchetti Handmade Pasta $18
- Bruschetta (pomodori & mushroom)

The pizza is pretty solid, the fiocchetti pasta was unique and tasty (with three cheeses and a kick of pear), but the bruschetta was just okay to me. Wouldn't reorder that again. 

Overall, the atmosphere here is cozy and the service was very attentive. Two thumbs up!
author: Corinna T.

description: Great Lunch/Brunch place with outdoor seating.  A thumbs up for bringing your dog.  Good wine list mostly Italy.  Eggs Benedict (salmon) supper generous portion.  Homemade pasta, good thin crust pizza.  Very friendly neighborhood vibe.
author: elissa s.

description: Really solid food to fill your Italian craving. It's a family-run business with friendly servers. I can only speak to the dish I had, but all the vegetables were fresh and cooked to perfection. The portions are enormous here, and I'd call this a casual Italian family style restaurant. It's also very loud inside, and lots of kids running around - so not a good date spot, but good to drop in for some tasty Italian food. Make sure you make a reservation because there is no space to wait. We waited in the doorway where we were directed to, because it was cold, and people had to awkwardly step around us. Solid and fresh food.
author: Kelly A.

description:
Delicious pasta, good service. We have been twice - I had the mushroom ravioli with delicious truffle cream sauce the first time and the seafood pasta the second. Lots of amazing fresh seafood!

A bit on the pricey side, but worth it!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
We tried to come here once before and they had just closed between lunch and dinner.  This time, we just made it for the end of lunch and are so glad that we did.  The place is very nice and the staff very friendly and helpful.  They serve a nice Italian bread and olive oil for dipping as you are deciding.  There are a lot of yummy things on their lunch menu to choose from!  Service was prompt and efficient, we didn't wait long.  I had the lasagna, my wife the porcini mushroom ravioli with black truffle cream sauce and my son the spaghetti carbonara.
My lasagna was excellent, very meaty and the portion was enormous.  It was also served hot, which such is not always the case with lasagna (I hate when it is cold in the middle!).  My wife's ravioli were also very good... I stole one!  Nice pasta, not too heavy, great mushroom filling and an excellent truffle cream.  My son's spaghetti carbonara was the only weak item, it was very dry, too little sauce, he didn't even finish it, which is not normal for him.
All said though, great place.  We will be back again for sure.
author: Joe T.

description: We called ahead on a rainy Sunday evening to ask about their outdoor seating since we were travelling with our dog. They were more than happy to accommodate us and our pup out front at one of their 2 patio tables underneath their roof overhang. We were completely sheltered from the rain and felt like we were back in Italy on their cute cobblestone porch. Bonus: there was a heater above our table and the food was AMAZING!!! We had an amazing time and we will come back soon!
author: Renee G.

description: My family and I came here last night for my daughters 22nd birthday.  The food was fabulous! Everybody was so happy with their meal.  The big plus was the service.  I felt like I was in Italy with the warm family style attention and conversation. Outstanding service from such beautiful group of people.
author: H K.

description: The margarita pizza is the best pizza ever! I would come here over and over again! Never had a pizza like this! The dough is buttery and the tomato sauce is amazing! To add that their Tiramisu dessert is delicious! Perfect sweetness!
author: Irais L.

description: We had a wonderful meal catered for 20 people last Sunday.  We ordered  several pizzas, an assortment of Bruschetta, Cesare Salad, Rigatoni & meatballs, Eggplant Parmigiana and for desert an amazing lemon cake.  The meal was so delicious and enjoyed by all.  The catering manager made everything so easy.  We had a great selection of food, something for everyone.  I would definitely order from Trattoria da Vittorio again.  We have eaten in the restaurant and had delicious meals.  Thank you
author: Marilyn T.

description:
Friday night get together with BFF.  She picked this place which used to be Cafe for All Seasons many seasons ago before it closed.  So, I knew it was going to be a small place for dinner.  The place was jam packed at 7:30 PM. We waited a long time before the guy managing the door showed up and was told 15 mins wait.  At least there was a floor heater by the front door to keep us warm.  

Wait staff was good but the busboys need more training. They were kind of rushed and abrupt in a not good way.  A few birthday celebrants were serenaded by the staff as well as some guy who would jump off his bar stool and blast a few sounds off his trumpet at the birthday babies.  

3 of us had a cup of cream of mushroom soup. It was creamy, decadently rich with good mushroom flavor.  The egg pizza was good too. My special crab in champagne sauce over pasta noodles at $24 was not worth it.  Too bland.  Hubby had the carbonara where a fried egg was placed on top of his pasta. I can make a better carbonara where the raw egg is mixed into the dish.  BFF was not feeling well and didn't touch her pasta.  We liked our Italian Pinot which was $48.  The meal came to $180.  Steep if you order wine.  

The place was 4 alarm loud we couldn't talk have a conversation without yelling.  Lots of kids and loud adults.
author: Ry T.

description:
Yummy, quick, friendly staff, few tables outside, nice interior deco, what's not to like?
Menu is in English, yay.
Still not sure why the waiters use Italian words instead of English, but I guess some patrons like it.
Beware of the Creme Brûlée, it's actually a cheesecake.
author: Matthew C.

description: Southern Italian.  Specials tonight included a stuffed pork and risotto with speck and radicchio that were excellent.  Good wine list with only Italian wine.  Bread served with good olive oil.  Family friendly.  Will definitely be back.
author: Jen J.

description:
We came here for brunch on fathers day. I hadn't been here since it was the Cafe For All Seasons and didn't even notice when they closed or when this place opened so it's been a while. Firstly we wanted to make a reservation for around noon on Sunday but upon calling, found out that they do not take reservations, so we had to plan on getting here early before they opened to insure a table for 7, so we got there at quarter to 11 to get first dibs on a table. 

They served us bread and we ordered the Calamari as an appetizer. The Calamari tasted fresh but average in taste. The bread they served was very dry and served with a cup of olive oil.  

I had the Fiocchetti  (Homemade Pasta stuffed with 3 Italian cheeses, pear in gorgonzola cream sauce. it was good but didn't really wow me though. Kind of average for the cost.   
My brother had the Grilled chicken, buffalo mozzarella, sautéed spinach panini, my sister had the Handmade Porcini Mushroom Ravioli with black truffle cream sauce, my dad had the Veal Scaloppine , lemon caper sauce , vegetable and potatoes, my sister in law had the Spaghetti Carbonara eggs, guanciale, onions and parmiggiano cheese, my mom had the Smoked Salmon and Caramelized onions omelette and my niece had the Micky Mouse cheese pizza. 

After finishing our brunch, my brother, sister, dad and sister in law all agreed that they were expecting their entrees to be better. I also thought my entree to be a little better but wasn't expecting it to be great though. My mom was the only one who loved her omelette and of course my six year old niece had very high praise for her personal pizza. 

We ordered two tiramisu's and one creme brûlée cheesecake, both very good. The bill for 6 adults and one child was just under $160 before gratuity; with no wine or beer ordered. A few years ago I would have considered that overpriced for quality of food, but everything in San Francisco is so expensive these days, nothing surprises me anymore. 

The restaurant is nice with good atmosphere and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. Our waiter; didn't catch his name was a charming and friendly young Italian guy from Salerno. He told us a little about himself and offered to take photos with my brother's phone. 

All in all I thought it was pretty good; probably because I went there with no expectations and it was better than half of the places where we frequently dine. My sister in law was a bit let down because she went on the high reviews on Yelp and then hyped it up to other members of my family who then also expected it to be amazing. It's like being hyped up for a movie that people are raving about and when you see it, it's always a letdown because it didn't quite meet your expectations. I would have added a fourth star if they took reservations. 

On an off note, take my advise and never go out to an Italian restaurant with someone who's "been to Italy" You know the type! the pretentious showoff wannabe type who go on and on about their superior knowledge of Italian cuisine who just won't shut up! .. I'm not mentioning names and everyone in my family except for my niece have "been to Italy" but I just thought I'd throw that in because those people; a lot of them here on Yelp just annoy me! hahaha
author: David A.

description: I really don't understand where all the four and five star reviews are coming from. I am not a picky eater at all, and I love Italian food. I was hoping this would be fast favorite of mine. I ordered the Gnocchi with pesto sauce. It was AWFUL. I was with a big group and the waitstaff was nice but not very attentive I was never able to get anyone's attention to ask for something that would have added flavor to my meal. It was also super loud which was annoying. I highly doubt I'll ever go back. I don't mind paying a high price but it better taste good.
author: Alison J.

description:
Came here for my son and sisters'a birthday dinner.   We had a large group of 12.  Had no problem with reservations and service was great.  I had the Cioppino, which was great. It's a large plate, I suggest you share it with someone.  Everyone else had different kinds of pasta and a short rib dinner with polenta which I was told was very delicious. 

The tiramisu was excellent.  My really enjoyed the Nutella calzone.  They were both great.  They also have very reasonably priced bottles of wines.  Parking was easy.  

I recommend this place to anyone that likes Italian food.
author: Yesenia R.

description: One of my favorite neighborhood restaurants. Vittorio is always friendly and the waiters amazing. The food is fabulous, especially the mushroom raviolis. One of my favorites also their bruschettas. No reservations but worth the wait
author: Anette A.

description:
I went here with a big party for a birthday lunch on Sunday.  I had their fish special, but also sampled my friend's spaghetti and meatballs, burrata, tiramisu, lemon cake, and caramel gelato.  The burrata was smooth and silky.  The branzino was very fresh and had nice seasoning.  I also liked the potatoes and veggies that came with it.   The spaghetti and meatballs was pretty good (not the best).  I loved their dessert.  Since it was my friend's dad's birthday, they comped us multiple deserts on the house.

I am very impressed with the service and with my meal, for the price range.  I would definitely go here again, and bring people with me.
author: Katherine G.

description:
my family and I came here for Italian food 
I was blown away how the flavor of the food is so authentic and delicious. the service here is the best I have seen in. I will recommend this location to everyone
author: Norma C.

description:
Great weeknight dinner here and can't wait to return!

I'm typically not in the West Portal area so I had never even heard of this place. A friend of mine suggested it for post-work bites and wine and it was perfect!

Atmosphere is warm and casual enough for catching up with a friend while still nice enough for a family gathering or romantic dinner. 

We had some red wine and the Bella pizza. Wine list is manageable and they have glasses, half bottles, and bottles. 

Menu was also focused--lots of classic Italian dishes. Good portions, fresh ingredients and fair prices. The pizza we had was perfection. Delicious burata cheese and thinly sliced eggplant. Perfectly charred crust! The pastas and main sounds great too. I definitely want to return for date night with the beau and try some entrees.

Service was pretty much perfect. We sat at the bar and had just the right amount of attention. The bread and olive oil to start was a nice touch as well.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Saying this is our favorite restaurant somehow still feels like an understatement. Service is superb - friendly, generous and they even will pour you wine while you wait! The food is fantastic and the rotating specials are always exciting. 

Try their bruschetta, lasagna or limoncello cake... you won't be disappointed. 

Furthermore, my now husband and I had this crazy idea for our wedding - to build a cannoli tower instead of a cake - and immediately thought of Vittorio's (family favorite). He is set up for catering, so he made everything fresh and went onsite to put them together. They were such a huge success; our guests have not stopped talking about it!
author: Haeley G.

description:
My review and experience of "Trattoria Da Vittorio" in San Carlos. 
 
Excited to be able to see Vittorio D'Urzo has taken on a new adventure and opened a restaurant in "the city of good living" - San Carlos (my home for the last 12 yrs). Tough area since it's very old school money driven. But I have to say - it's about time we actually have an authentic restaurant driven by a truly passionate person. It's right down town on Laurel St (just one block off El Camino south of Holly St.) - very easy to get to. 

First let me say that Vittorio has made sure to cover every aspect of fine dining, great service, great drinks and hospitality that forces you to make another reservation before you leave. You enjoy the moment you walk towards the doors and continue to look back when you leave. He has done himself, with great commitment, providing a true taste of Italy. I have already made arrangements for a party of 16 in the private room and look forward to having a great time. 

The atmosphere grabs you really good. One side fit for Italian family dining. You get the l aromas from kitchen and the buzz of the restaurant just makes you hungry. Other side is set up with a bar, TVs, few more tables, private dining rooms and just classy modern style. 

It's a must go!!!!!! Congrats Vittorio!!!
author: Vinnie V.

description: I stop in here for a meal every time I'm in the area. Excellent main courses, wines, and desserts to die for. Plus, an excellent atmosphere for intimate dining. They are small, and don't take reservations, so try them at off-peak hours.
author: Tom D.

description: By far the best Italian food this side of twin peaks.  Everything from the food, service, and atmosphere are outstanding.  I recommend the pizza, bruschetta, and sole.  Each of these dishes were equally good. I heard the meatballs are also delicious.  I'll be trying them next time. Also, they do have a number of dishes that are gluten free.  If you see a big line in the Portal it most likely is for Trattoria da Vittorio so get a reservation or be freezing in the marine layer :).
author: Mike S.

description: If they simply advertised as an Italian restaurant, I would give them four stars. They are a cut above a Macaroni Grill. But since they claim to be "authentic Italian", I can only give them three stars. We were in Italy in April, and I finally learned what "al dente" really means. The pasta here was only slightly toothy, but not really there. And the sauces (we had the carbonara and the ox tail) were tasty, but not nearly as rich as what we had in Italy. If you want truly authentic Italian food, I would highly recommend Roma Antica. (Check out my previous review of them.)
author: Steve L.

description: These folks are about to open a location in San Carlos, so I couldn't resist visiting last night when I was up in SF. What a great vibe they have! It's a very friendly, neighborhood joint with very good quality food and lots of seemingly happy customers. I got there a bit early and had dinner alone at the counter (watching the Warriors) and had a wonderful time! The place filled up while I was there and is clearly a very popular spot! I had Vittorio's mothers famous Lasagna and a nice Caesar salad...and plenty of nice Merlot. The Warriors won...it was nearly heaven! I can't wait to see this atmosphere repeated in San Carlos!
author: Jim M.

description: Still 5 stars every time I come back to SF.   Got the Kale salad - pretty good,  rigatona calabrese FABULOUS, and the Fiocchetti - DELICIOUS.  As always Mateo is awesome, easy on the eyes and very nice, good service.   The Sengiovese Principe wine went nicely with the foods.
author: Rob K.

description: Giving this place 5 stars for service and four stars for the food. Although the quality of the food was great, and the caesar salad we ordered was yummy, the pizza (egg pizza) we ordered was little cold when it came out (although still very tasty). We usually head to the Italian place down the street, Spiazzo, but decided to take a chance here instead. We told this to our waiter and he was happy to hear. Later they thanked us for giving them a chance with a tiramisu on the house! Definitely would give this place another visit :)
author: Andi B.

description: Their pear & Gorgonzola pasta is out of this world. The pesto gnocchi was good too, but did not stand out in comparison.
author: Adi F.

description:
A couple years ago, this place deserved solid 5 stars. But my experience last Friday was super underwhelming. We ordered the lasagna and the duck risotto. The lasagna was dry but ok. It was definitely not worth the $20. We also had the duck risotto. It was super bland, white risotto, with one duck leg on top. The duck was dry and over cooked. The sauce on the risotto had a really strong chicken flavor. Like someone dissolved one of those chicken bullion cubes in some cream. It was way too salty and tasted artificial.

The one upside was that we got our food less than 10 mins after we ordered it.

The service was really bad. The waiter kept rushing us and interrupted our conversation multiple times. Sorry! We just couldn't eat any faster!! Also, no one bothered to wipe our table after dinner but before desert. 

This place has a price tag of a fancy Italian restaurant but the experience and the food was just not good.
author: Elina P.

description:
Excellent service! The servers were very friendly. We had a very good sized table with ample space for all our orders. We had the bruschetta sampler , fiochetti, ravioli, and the Milanese.
Our Nutella calzone was EXCELLENT! I've never tasted Nutella that way...
author: Cay A.

description: We absolutely love this place. It's one of our families favorite Italian restaurants to go to with the kids. The manager and staff always remember you and greet you so kindly when you arrive and leave, and treat you so nicely while you are there. One time my toddler even threw up halfway through our meal, and we were so embarrassed we got the food to go and the staff was so kind to us. They even sent us home with a free dessert. Not to mention the food is so delicious. The wood fired margarita pizza is one the best I've had in the city. We took my two year old here for her birthday recently and they gave her an ice cream scoop with a candle and sang to her. It was pretty special. I highly recommend this place for all families!
author: Alyssa Z.

description: My special go to Italian restaurant. Food staff ambience could not get any better !! Love taking out of town visitors to enjoy this wonderful restaurant.  Victor knows how to treat his patrons well!
author: Christina L.

description:
This is my partner and I's absolute FAVORITE restaurant. We come here 1-3 times a month because it's so great! We're totally nit picky foodies and never ever have any complaints about the restaurant. The service alone deserves 5 stars. The waiters are fantastic and always seem like they genuinely enjoy their job. Vittorio himself is often there and always greets us as does the rest of the staff. It really has a wonderful, family feel to it. And the food. THE FOOD. I was raised with a grandfather who is a first generation Sicilian American so I am really picky when it comes to Italian food! The food tastes like something that would be handmade. The bread and olive oil they bring is always yummy. The olive oil tastes like the good stuff you'd actually get in Italy. My partner and I always get the bruschetta with burrata and prosciutto and it's always delicious. They don't skimp on the burrata and the prosciutto is very good. We also really love the bruschetta with nduja. Their polpette are wonderful and their caprese has burrata which really makes it better! 

Our favorite entree is far and away the fiocchetti. The contrast of the sweet pear with the more pungent Gorgonzola is heavenly. I could eat it everyday of the week. My partner loves spaghetti and meatballs and raves about theirs. We also love their lasagne. They have cioppino on their specials menu sometimes and my partner said it was excellent. Basically, everything we've eaten here is fantastic. 

Their dessert is really yummy and while I usually go for their classic tiramisu, I always have a hard time deciding what to get. Their profiteroles are scrumptious and the caramel gelato with sea salt is always great option. I always look forward to my next meal here.
author: Tori R.

description:
Have you ever been to a place where you weren't impressed by the main dishes, but liked the side dishes?

That's how I feel about this place.

The burrata cheese was fantastic, and so was the tiramisu at the end.

But in-between was the lackluster lasagna that tasted like it was stuffed with bread crumbs.

It was one of the weirdest, yet plainest tasting lasagnas I've ever had.

Also, it was very unfresh, cold, and even though they attempted to heat it up, I know days old lasagna when I taste it, you know?

And with tip and tax at $20 a slice for the lasagna alone, I was honestly hoping for something that would taste as fantastic as the burrata starter we had.

But it didn't.

The tiramisu was really good and fresh though. 

But man, that lasagna was an epic fail. I mean even Stouffer's would have been better.

3.5 stars rounded down to 3 stars due to the high price of the main entree that didn't taste very good.
author: Jack R.

description: Ample seating (including for those with children, attentive, courteous wait staff and tasty, large wood fired pizzas. We order the house made gnocchi and caesar salad, along with the pizza bella and margherita; all were good. Could have used a little more dressing on the caeasar salad but I didn't bother to ask, yet I know they would have brought it to me had I requested it.
author: Evelyn S.

description:
I've eaten here twice now and have gotten great service each time, despite it being crazy busy. West Portal is a cute neighborhood and this restaurant fits right in. It's perfect for a casual bite, date night or family dinner. 

The mushroom ravioli is amazing. The smooth cream sauce has so much flavor. I split the dish and wish i selfishly ordered a plate for myself. Carbonara comes with an over med egg on top (yum) ...plus, love fresh shaved cheese on every dish, making it even more decadent. Between the margherita pizza and prosciutto with mushrooms, i would have the simple margherita again. It's a great light crust and pizza overall with really fresh tasting ingredients.

Why go to Olive Garden in Stonestown when Trattoria Da Vittorio is so close by!
author: Samantha L.

description:
we eat here at least 3x a month. Vittorio and the staff are amazing. Favorite Dishes: 
tomato and burrata, calamari, chicken and eggplant.
author: Daniel P.

description:
Had an amazing time at this establishment. 

It was my best friend's birthday and the entire service staff came out to sing for him.

Food was absolutely fantastic. I must say my taste buds had a beautiful intercourse with the fiocchetti, little tortellini stuffed with pear and cooked in a gorgonzola based condiment. I'm still dreaming about them.

At the end of the meal I got to meet Roberto (our server) as well as a few other servers, I believe Matteo and Gokan (forgive my spelling if I am incorrect). They seemed very nice and genuine people.

Pricing was just great. Fair and correct based om our choices.

Bravo!
author: Mr. Food G.

description:
I had high hopes for Trattoria da Vittorio, but I left displeased and unwilling to return. Our server, Roberto, was awesome, very friendly and attentive. But the food was just okay and overpriced.

The spaghetti and meatballs dish ($18) was good, but not outstanding. The tomato sauce was hardy, not too tart or sour, but a little watery. Spaghetti noodles were cooked nicely, al dente with a nice bite. Meatballs the size of ping pong balls were gigantic and tasty, but not stellar. And it was a little unsettling that they were still a little pink in the center. The lasagna with meat sauce ($17) had over five layers of lasagna noodles, but I felt like there wasn't enough meat and cheese filling between the noodles. There wasn't enough sauce either. Overall this dish was too heavy on the carbs and very dense. However, the burrata cheese and prosciutto bruschetta appetizer ($9) was probably the best of the night. The toasted sliced baguette was very crispy, a nice base for the rich cheese and salty meat.

Overall, food was decent, but nothing too special or worth going across the city. Dishes are pricey but portion sizes are substantial enough for leftovers. I probably wouldn't revisit, as there are several other Italian restaurants in West Portal.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
I don't live nearby but I am definitely coming back. THANK YOU YELP FOR HELPING ME FIND THIS PLACE!!

We were looking for a lunch spot on a whim and decided to try out Trattoria da Vittorio. How lucky we were. I judge all of my authentic italian places by their gnocchi and I must say, one of the best gnocchis to date. They were able to split it into two sauces -- pesto and gorgonzola. The serving was HUGE! Each bite was tender yet perfectly al dente. Everyone at the table loved it. My friends got the home made lasagna, which was a huge entree and they couldn't even finish the dish splitting it! I'll be getting that next time -- I had a bite and it was so good.
author: Sharon C.

description: italian restaurant with real italian people. Authentic lasagna.Nice desserts too, excellent espresso drinks.
author: Rob D.

description: This place is great food, atmosphere and costumer service was great. Went to this place around closing time and they let us in with open arms. Thanks to the crew we were able to get in and eat and enjoy our time.
author: Kevin B.

description:
We yelped this spot after family pics and man am I glad we chose this place. It was delicious!!! My husband tried their special which was a ravioli stuffed with ricotta cheese and butternut squash. It tasted like fall in plate form! I tried a cheese and pear stuffed pasted in a cream sauce that was just incredible. It tasted like the best version of white mac and cheese with a hint of texture and sweetness from the pear. 

It's not a huge place but the atmosphere was great and it's definitely somewhere we'd come back to next time we're out this way.
author: Yesenia A.

description: I give it 3 stars but I have to say I'm rating things this high simply because of the good service. Without the service, I'd give them 2 stars. Simply said, for me, the price does not match the quality. I'm one of the people who are surprised at all the high marks being handed out, but opinions, and meals, vary. Perhaps it was a bad night. I ordered the antipasti for one ($14) and received one slice each of the 3 meats they offer and a few very small pieces of parmesan cheese. Ok, not out of the ordinary for a high end Italian restaurant. However, the taste of the meats was unremarkable. No better than you'd get at your grocery store deli. The cheese was good though. I also ordered the veal scaloppini and I've definitely had better. The veal was basically tasteless and a tad over-cooked. Usually this situation can be remedied with a tasty sauce, but the mushroom and marsala sauce was bland as well. I rarely salt food, but I found myself grabbing the salt shaker more than once. For dessert, the cannoli was ok, but unremarkable. I won't go into detail about my wife's meal but she felt the same overall. I kept commenting to my her that I've had better at the Gold Mirror. The 2 places list in the same price range but I felt like one was at a higher quality level than the other. As I mentioned, at these prices I expect more. I will leave with a positive note and say, again, that the service was good and the wine portions generously poured.
author: Rich M.

description: Love this place! Friendly staff and amazing food! Brussels sprouts are divine! My kids love the pizza.
author: Amy G.

description:
1st time here and we ordered the following:

-Fried Calamari & Organic Artichoke (Just OK)
-Spaghetti Carbonara (Good)
-Handmade Porcini Mushroom Ravioli (OK)

*Friendly Servers
author: Wendy L.

description: I have been dining here for years after my daughter move to SF for school.  The food and staff are excellent!  My favorite it the pear ravioli with Gorgonzola sauce.
author: Sue R.

description: Very good Italian food and the service is amazing! The staff is super inviting. Their pizza and Cioppino was so delicious. Feels like home away from home
author: Donata C.

description:
I was really looking forward to trying a new restaurant that was so highly recommended via YELP.  Unfortunately it was such a bummer.  
Please note, I rarely go online to make bad reviews anymore (I don't think it's very nice) however since this was so misleading I feel others should hear what we experienced.
Food: I ordered the famous lasagna, it tasted like the meat was going off (luckily it wasnt I didnt get sick, just had a sour taste) and the lasagna looked like it was still frozen from a box! It was a huge slap of food, and when I cut into it, I was getting half luke warm, half cold lasagna.... Usually pasta should come out boiling, or something to show it was just made but unfortunately this was just so so so bad. layers stuck together and just not yum. The waiter also never came by to notice that I didn't even make a dent in it, so when the check came we just asked for a box.

Hopefully the other dishes are super good- the place was packed! Just don't order the lasagna if I were you.
author: Julie W.

description: This rating is strictly for my dinner last night as I love the atmosphere and service is generally good. The special was parpadelle with crab in a champagne sauce.
