Sounds delicious, right? Ummm, no. The pasta was light and airy but the crab tasted like bad tuna from a can (and not albacore). Not seasoned and even with salt, was bland. Lack of sauce prevented me from soaking the tuna. I wasn't alone - the couple next to me also ordered it and sent it back. When my waiter asked how it was as I only ate half, I said "not so good" but he didn't inquire why or offer something else. At $26, I was still hungry when I got home, which is not good. I will be back to give them another chance but hope they read this and taste their food before sending it out.
author: Michelle O.

description: Visited on Nov 10th.  Place was packed when we arrived at 6pm.  We did not make a reservation and had to wait about half an hour for a table of four.  Sole was ok to good, braised ribs could use some more gravy, saugage inside rigatoni was really hard.  My cousin had the special $45 risotto with truffle and it was only average.  Our waiter was over worked and only came to us twice.  The busperson did the rest of the work, including getting our check.  We had decided to skip dessert when we had difficulties getting attention of our waiter for a menu.  Could have been a better experience if the place was not that busy.
author: Leo C.

description:
Possibly my favorite restaurant in the entire city. The food is always delicious and fresh. The pizzas are true southern Italian style, and the pasta is perfectly chewy. They also have killer desserts! But most importantly, the owner, the waiters, and all the other staff here really treat you like family. They are extremely accommodating, attentive, and cheerful! Bonus: most of the staff is actually from Italy! We come here literally every time we have an Italian craving because we find that every time we try a different place, it just doesn't compare. 

Vegetarian tip: you can custom order pasta dishes to be vegetarian! They are so great!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Our most recent visit I should have listed a 2-star rating based on service. However, we've been here a few times prior to the Trattoria receiving its Michelin recommendation. 

Each time both food and service were outstanding. Accommodating and attentive along with great food has always made us wanting to return sooner than later.

This last dining experience is one that I can't shake off and hope is only a one-time scenario. 

I barely even knew who our server was during the meal. So much that when we were requesting our check, we had to ask one of the wait staff to identify him. Extremely disappointing since it's wasn't a busy evening and we were a small party of 4. 

I'm hoping that the new Michelin recommendation hasn't made everyone's head inflate that much that they've forgotten the reason why they received the recommendation. High quality food along with superior service. 

We'll be returning again but if it we have the same type of recent experience we'll have to unfortunately say goodbye for the time being.
author: Ligaya C.

description: I came here because my family members highly recommended this restaurant. It opens at 5:30 pm and fills up quickly so you have to go early to find parking and get a seat. It was good but i felt that it didn't live up to the hype that I expected. I had the rigatoni and while it was tasty, it was a dish I could have  made at home.
author: Liv T.

description: My friend and I had a great time at this restaurant tonight. We started out with a yummy appetizer and finished with a spaghetti with meatballs and a mixed seafood pasta. My friend thought the seafood pasta was absolutely delicious. We also had a glass of the Layered Cake Cab, which was very tasty. Our waiter, Nico, was great. He had us laughing all night and he was very attentive. The manager and the employee, Miguel were also very kind. Great evening and very authentic Italian food!
author: Alicia A.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this place. The spaghetti carbonara topped with egg didn't really stand out for me; maybe I've tried better so it didn't really made a huge impact on me. The flavor was average..

My friend got the lasagna and the layers were a bit hard/crusty and the sauce looked premade or old. A very average lasagna if you ask me. (I also tried her lasagna so I'm saying my opinion)

The waiter was really attentive and refilling the water and making sure everything was ok. I asked to split the bill but for some reason, the guy didn't understand and did a mess but thats ok, I guess.

I don't think I'd come again.
author: Kathy D.

description: Oh what a beautiful meal... and it was delivered via Caviar! Perfect caprese salad--ripe tomatoes, super fresh, thick, melt-in-your-mouth burrata, exquisite balsamic dressing, fresh basil & arugula--didn't need a grind of black pepper, just perfect. And DO NOT MISS the gnocchi... I always get it with their outrageously rich pesto, molto bene! And fresh (really fresh) Italian bread is always included. So happy ~
author: Rebecca R.

description:
I've eaten dinner here a few times and have always been impressed. They're usually fairly busy, but I've never had to wait for a table on a weeknight. The service is always very friendly and the waiters have always been able to answer all of our questions about their food and wine.

Everything that I've had has been delicious. The brussels sprouts and the bruschetta with burrata and prosciutto appetizers are fantastic, and are an excellent way to start off a meal, especially with a nice glass of wine.

The pizzas are pretty good, but not fantastic, but are still definitely the best pizzas in West Portal. The veal scaloppini is also excellent. Most recently, the daily special was baked branzino, which was probably the best branzino I've ever had. It was tender and moist on the inside, yet was lightly crispy on the outside. 

Trattoria da Vittorio is an excellent choice for dining in the West Portal area - or even in SF in general.
author: Allen T.

description: My aunt and I met for dinner and we both thought the place looked nice. Our server was also very nice. Our meal was terrible. The calamari was bland and so were it's two dipping sauces; the fiocchetti was cold and the margherita was soggy and had hardly any cheese. I wasn't impressed.
author: L. W.

description: The food here is so, so tasty! The pastas are all terrific. The service is extremely professional. Best in the neighborhood. And we love Vittorio. He is catering our upcoming wedding, and we know the food will be the highlight of the evening!
author: Sarah P.

description: THE BEST!! I love this place so much. Authentic Italian cuisine. I got the seafood pasta and it was the best pasta I've ever tasted in my life! The staff was super nice and I love how close they are to each other and how treat each other like family. Our server was very hospitable, I wasn't able to get his name but he was a very good server and made our night memorable. I have no complaints whatsoever.
author: Izabelle Y.

description: I decided to try this place out based on the yelp reviews so today I woke asking myself..."did walk into the wrong restaurant last night?" Bread was stale. I asked for a bottle of dry red, was sold a bottle of sweet sugary wine, asked for no onions in my carbonara.... onions came.... but no black pepper in the sauce... isn't that what the "carbon" in carbonara is? Also it was cold. The special of the day, a beef dumpling also served cold and the profiteroles for dessert were stuffed with cream from an aerosol can coated with syrup from a bottle.... I'd have been better off with a bottle of two buck chuck and a few boxes from the freezer aisle in Trader Joes for dinner.
author: Susan C.

description: As usual, Vittorio and his team make dinning mid-week a much needed pleasure. From the homestyle standards to the creative daily specials. Our visit tonight had a purpose; destress a long stressful day with a nce meal. We achieved our goal!! With the old favorites of lasagna and the combo chicken and eggplant parm how could we go wrong. Portions are good sized but not "americanized". So enough to satisfy a hearty eater with out the overstuffed feeling. We even snuck in room for a cannoli and some caramel gelato with sea salt & olive oil.
author: Frank S.

description:
Went back for a second visit. All was as before on our previous visit. Excellent food, excellent service. Everyone was very happy with both pasta and seafood dishes.

Based upon this visit, our table of four recommends the:
* Petrale sole
* Scialatielli
* Spaghetti polpette
* Spaghetti carbonara
* Nutellino
* Mamma's tiramisu
* House cabernet sauvignon

We had near perfect service from Roberto.

We look forward to our next visit.

What do you think?
author: Reyn J.

description:
Perfect restaurant in West Portal neighborhood for groups to eat family style and try all the delicious food on the menu. Also good for dates with the homey and romantic vibe.

The beginning ~ Burrata Bruschetta, the toast was crisp, the prosciutto as it should be and the Burrata perfect. The fried Calamari and artichokes served with a mint and olive oil dip -- oh yes it was good. Also loved the Caprese con Burrata, if you can't tell already say Burrata and it's a magic word for me!!!

The entrées ~ What got me to this place was my craving for Carbonara, and boy was it delicious creamy but still light and very tasty. The Porcini Ravioli bread sopping perfection...next came the Pollo Milanese, crisp crust and fresh tomato sauce with just the right anoint meant of garlic and oil. The highlight of entrees this evening was the Braised Short Ribs -- oh my!

Pizza ~ my favorite was the San Danielle which had prosciutto, wild arugula tomato and mozzarella and especially loved the thin light and flaky crust. Our group also shared the Margherita, a classic and always reliable to order.

Desert ~ hold onto your chair arms for Nutellino Calzone. Yup, simply a treasure. A calzone filled with warm Nutella what a delicious idea and the presentation was amazing too. Also adored the tiramisu!

I can't say anything more about how much I loved this place and recommend it to anyone wanting an impeccable Italian meal with a great ambiance. Solid five stars for me and my friends!
author: Maria M.

description: Incredible! Amazing service and food. Just moved to the city and I have been here for 3 weeks and come to this place 3 times so far and brought all my friends and family. Everyone is blown away by the service and food. This is my weekly spot now. Amazing lasagna and mushroom ravioli
author: P S.

description: This place is a perennial neighborhood favorite. Service is incredibly kind and welcoming even when it's busy, and the staff love kids and accommodate them beautifully. The pastas are always top-notch, as are the bruschettas, and their wine selection is extensive and interesting. Overall, totally unpretentious, simple Italian food made to a high standard.
author: Nicholas W.

description:
Came here for brunch on a Saturday around 12:30 pm and it was pretty empty, but by 1:00, this place was packed and for good reason. 

To start off, let me just say that the service was wonderful. It felt like we had not one, but three waiters, with someone almost always attending to us. Immediately after being seated we were given a plate of bread and olive oil. After taking our orders, all of our food came out in 10 minutes. Even when the restaurant got really busy at 1, we had no issue asking for a dessert  menu and getting the check promptly.

Now for the food; it was simply divine. I had a caprese panini and it was the best caprese panini I've ever had. For one, the panini was made with this delicious pizza bread. For another, the mozzarella was heavenly - so soft and melt-in-your-mouth creamy. But what made this panini stellar is the perfect ratio of bread:cheese:tomato:basil:balsamic vinegar. The panini could not have been more well balanced. 

For dessert, the tiramisu is wonderful! So light, not too sweet, and portion wise, the slice was huge. The only thing that could've made it better is maybe a hint of rum or kalhua. The nutella calzone and caramel gelato with sea salt and olive oil was well received by my table as well. Personally, the calzone seemed a bit heavy and carby after my panini, but if you're looking for a more filling dessert that's the way to go. As for the caramel gelato, I personally thought it was too sweet and the chocolate caramel chunks in it were a bit much, but hey if you have a sweet tooth you can't go wrong with it.

All in all this is a great Italian restaurant, and I'm so happy I stumbled upon it!
author: Umeet S.

description: Food was excellent. Service was also really friendly. Best lasagna I've had in a long time. Salmon bruchetta with the mustard was delicious.
author: Mike H.

description:
3 1/2 stars. Cute little Italian joint with a nice sized bar and sweet outdoor dining patio. Lovely decor. Good service. Decent food. I came into the restaurant really excited to try everything but left underwhelmed. 

Tried many menu items. Some items were better than others. I've been to Italy and had excellent carbonara there and in America. This one I thought to be just ok. It was served on the cold side which may have been the problem. 

However, I really loved the calamari and artichoke appetizer. Lightly breaded and fried well. The calamari was perfectly cooked and wasn't chewy. The breading could have been seasoned better but the two dipping sauces made up for it. One sauce was similar to a tartar sauce and other was a light citrus sauce. They worked well together and brought out the distinct flavors of the artichoke and calamari. 

I also enjoyed the chicken Milanese with eggplant. That was a winning entree. Would definitely order it again. The eggplant was excellent and complimented the chicken well. Was too full to try any desserts though they looked super yummy.
author: Rosalyn W.

description: This is now our third time here. If you're looking for fresh, authentic Italian food, this is the place to go! Whether you're craving for pizza or pasta...and don't forget the Brussels sprouts... oh man!!! If you don't like Brussels sprouts, this is the place to try it... I wouldn't be surprised if you become a convert
author: Alice A.

description: Incredible restaurant, awesome staff and amazing flavorful dishes! I wish I could try everything  highly recommended
author: Ricardo M.

description: The wait staff tried very hard to Please.The food was mediocre.What really concerned me was that the restraunt is filthy which I am holding the owner responsible for maintains.
author: Victoria S.

description:
I was very pleasantly surprised to find this gem in the West Portal neighborhood. I needed to carb up before the Nike Women's race, and I was glad to start my dinner here with tasty bread and fresh olive oil to dip it in. We ordered the bruschetta caponata (3 stars) and the beet salad (4 stars) to start. The bruschetta lacked cohesiveness - it was tasty but felt too much like two separate components (the bread and the caponata) for me. The salad was very fresh, very light and I adored the house-made vinegarette in just the right amount (JUST enough). I also appreciated that they split the salad for us.

For dinner I ordered the special pappardelle with wild boar ragu (3 stars). The fresh pasta was tasty and well-cooked and the amount was on-point. However the sauce was a little lacking in flavor. It kind of reminded me of a comfort dish mom might make, but didn't have any specialness to it. We also ordered a pizza - the bella, I believe - with eggplant, artichokes, and burratta (5 stars). Stop the presses, this is my new favorite pizza in SF. The crust is oven-fired PERFECTION and the mozzarella they use actually tastes like mozzarella!  It is enough to make me never want another American pizza again. I'm seriously rejoicing to see take-out and delivery options are available, because I can't wait to try the other za's on the menu.

After some debate, we opted not to get dessert and swore we'd order it next time. A couple minutes later, our waiter appeared with tiramisu in hand, laughing to himself, "next time." The tiramisu (5 stars) was clearly authentic - it was so incredibly light, spicy and sweet, soaked with good coffee. The lady fingers literally melted in your mouth. It was a completely different dish than anything else I've had by the same name here in the U.S.

I was also impressed with the hospitality of the staff from the time we walked in. It is clear that everyone there has ownership and pride in their job. The host staff, management, and waitstaff were all very attentive, professional and friendly. I love that many of them seem to be authentically Italian themselves - which shows in their service, as well as on the menu!
author: Catie F.

description: Ordered the burrata cheese and prosciutto bruschetta... so good! Also ordered the gnocchi with half gorgonzola cream and half tomato sauce. The gnocchi itself was a little heavy (physically) but I will always give appreciation to places like these that make their own pasta! Overall nice casual Italian place suitable for lunch or dinner.
author: SY T.

description:
Tonight was my First and Last Time at this Restaurant.
I ordered a Pinot Noir, since there are 3 on the wine list,
I never stated which one I wanted, but I did not know any of
the 3 so which ever one they brought was fine. When I tasted it I really liked it,
but it did not taste like Pinot Noir.. so I asked a waiter which one I was drinking,
and another person came over, and said it was Chianti!

Ok at that Point I am still happy.

The Lasagna was average, not bad, but my companion had the Gnocchi with Pesto,
and the Pesto was not good, it did not taste of Basil at all, however the Gnocchi were
good.

The reason for this review, is when my Credit Card was returned it was not mine!
I told the waiter, and waited a few minutes and they brought my card to me with my
check.

When I got home I checked my account, and lo and behold I was charged not only
for what my check was for, but another person's meal. To be honest, it was reversed,
my complaint, they did not tell me this, I had to get home to my PC and find this out.

That is not good business. The food can be good or bad, but when you mess  around with
someone's Credit Account and do not inform the patron that is very bad.

If that kind of thing continues, this place will not stay in Business!
author: Jerry W.

description: Lovely chef Picolo! Great vegetarian food! Loved the pesto ravioli and the desserts were great too!
author: Nandita D.

description: Went here for late lunch. Overall, decent Italian place. Service was attentive and meeting our needs.  The pizza was authentic Neopolitan style - a nice change.  The prosciutto was tender and delicious.  We will definitely return.
author: Le D.

description:
Forget my first review. This place serves food with the freshest ingredients and the service is amazing. My first experience was just a fluke because I ordered the wrong thing, and I've had nothing but great experiences since! Must try: Homemade Fiocchetti. It's to die for because the pasta is fresh and it has three different types of cheese! You really can't go wrong with that. I would also suggest getting the buratta with tomato, balsamic vinegar and olive oil. It's really simple, but soooo good because all of the ingredients were probably picked/made that day. Also, listen to whatever specials are available because those are usually good too. 

I've been back with family members and am planning on going with the hubby for dinner one of these days. The owner is really nice and you can tell he loves what he does, which is really nice to see.
author: Steph L.

description: After the Tiramisu on the house and the delicious pear infused pasta, this place was screaming for a 5 star review. A true Italian gem of San Francisco.
author: Dane J.

description: Tallen/Miller wedding dinner could not have been better - the best food & service ever!
author: Denise B.

description: Delicious! Family owned Italian restaurant (I think?) with great service. I always order the bruschetta combo. It's a must! For my entree I always get the spaghetti carbonara...so delicious! Great portion and value for the price. For dessert they have these Nutella calzones that are awesome! But then you can't go wrong with anything fried with Nutella!
author: Vickiiieee V.

description:
Amazingly yummy place . It's a small Italian fun place to be at with your family or alone ))). Pizza , bruschetta, pasta , seafood etc. - everything is really good . The owner and his staff are super friendly and pleasant people . 

P.S.: gelato w oil is really good
author: Tetyana G.

description: Probably had the best and freshest calamari I've tasted. The pasta I had was delicious, and all of my friends thought their pasta was good too. Great west portal spot.
author: Deion N.

description: Wow. That was probably the most well run restaurant we've been to in a LONG time. From the owner/manager holding the door open, to being immediately seated by the hostess, to amazingly fast food service, this place is a well oiled machine. And to top it off, that food was AMAZING. Hubs got the lasagna and I got the Fiocchetti with Gorgonzola cream sauce and man, it was delish. Hubs said it was some of the best Italian he's ever had. The location is great and we found parking easily, our table neighbors were super friendly, and the staff was ALL over it. Props to this restaurant and owner/manager...a great experience overall. Glad we picked Trattoria for dinner tonight!
author: Lauren S.

description:
This place was amazing! It was incredibly busy but we only had to wait about 20 minutes to get a seat which was awesome. All of the food came to the table very quickly, and there was never a point where we didn't have something on the table that everyone could eat! They even gave us a free desert, which I think was because of the wait (which again, wasn't even a long wait. I've waited much longer for a pizza than I did my tables entire meal) 
the bruchetta is to die for! It is a MUST HAVE!
author: Josh W.

description: Got to love neighborhood restaurant.  From the start our host and hostess took care of us while we waited for our table.  Then our waiter Roberto took over and continued the hospitality.  The food was great from appetizer of calamari, burrata, and ceasar salad.  Our main course of gnocchi,  eggplant  parmesean,  veal and pizza was fantastic.  To top it off our waiter provided a complementary  dessert!  This is how I,remember the city and give them a try and it won't disappoint.
author: james v.

description:
Meh. When they first opened, a few years ago, the food was a little better. Now, it's about average, maybe slightly above. But our lunch today was our last - we won't be returning. We had the spaghetti and meatballs, which as stated above was much better a few years ago. We also had the petrale sole piccata, that was good. Why we won't be returning: My wife was given a teacup with a large lipstick stain on the side. This completely spoiled the mood of our lunch. My wife wrote a note on the bill about the lipstick stain, and when our server came to pick up the tab, she pointed it out to him and said please make sure that the manager reads this. Our server said " I am the manager", read it, and walked away. He returned in about 20 seconds, and said " Look, we get about 500 guests in here on a weekend, once in a while a little lipstick on a cup, it's normal" . That was our cue to bid adieu to Trattoria da Vittorio. Had the manager came back and said "I'm sorry about that Madame, we will strive to do better next time, and here's a discount coupon to ensure you come back and give us another try" or something nice, that would have been different.My wife has doubts if he is really the manager as HE DOESN'T KNOW BASIC CUSTOMER SERVICE  - at least apologize first.
He even  made us feel that we are at fault  with noticing that half mouth sharp red lipstick-stained cup. Oh yes, we should have said "Sorry for noticing your dirty cup, next time we will just close our eyes".This awful experience occurred today, May 27, 2017 before 3pm to 4pm. Addio, Trattoria.
author: James P.

description: The home made lasagna is the truth. So delicious and the service good also. Great red wine selection and cool atmosphere. I will be back .
author: Juan V.

description: I love this place. I love the people, I love the food, I love the wine, and I love the fact that you don't have to go all the way downtown to get decent Italian food.
author: Rick S.

description: I came to this place with my family on a Sunday afternoon. It was pretty crowded, with waiters rushing around going from table to table aiding the needs of the customers. We got our seating right when we walked in and the waiters were very polite. We ordered with high hopes of good authentic Italian food, but when they served us, the food looked plain. The spaghetti and meatballs were normal, having the meatballs a little dry and the noodles being mediocre. The pumpkin gnocchi in my opinion was the best dish, but in itself, it was ok. It tasted like mashed potatoes and gravy. The gnocchi with tomato sauce was not very flavorful. The Caesar salad with prawns was too salty, as well the fried calamari, and the beet salad was not worth $15.
author: Ambur -.

description:
Had a sweet dinner experience with my husband last night.  

The starters were just average.  I didn't love the Cesar although the the lettuce was super fresh and crisp and it was dressed properly.  The calamari is pretty meh.  We have ordered it every time.   Nothing to get excited about.  

My main course was delicious!  It was the fish special.   Perfectly cooked and very light and fresh.  Asparagus was crisp and the mashed potatoes to die for.  

Husband has the seafood pasta.  He liked it.  

We had the cheesecake dessert.  Just okay. 

Outstanding service.  Loud but spirited.   Sweet west portal establishment.
author: Pauline C.

description:
Everything about this place is great!  We celebrated our daughter's birthday at this restaurant.  We ordered foods from its lunch menu, and all of them were yummy, especially the food I ordered, the poccini mushroom ravioli in black truffle cream sauce, out of this world!

The service was very attentive, our waiter surprised us at the end with a birthday cake platter with a candle for our daughter, that was very sweet of him :)
author: Meiko S.

description: The kids and I really enjoyed our meal here tonight. While we had to wait for @30 minutes. It was peaceful on the sidewalk and the staff was polite. Many people were waiting with a glass of wine. My son had the veal, my daughter the Fiocchetti and I had the eggplant parmigiana. All three were excellent. The veal was probably the best as I also enjoyed the sides. My eggplant and my daughters pasta came solo on the plate. Very enjoyable experience-we would come again.
author: Monica T.

description:
4 star for this time food. 

I was about to go to the other restaurant but just realize they are not open till 4:30. So.. I gave this place one more try. Last time I order the bruchata and meatball pasta. It was bad. The meatball pasta was not good, very plain and dry, bruchata was not fresh, so pretty disappointed. 

Enough for the last time review. This time this place amazed me. Mixed seafood was pretty good, pasta was cooked to the perfection, the meat was juicy.  My bf ordered Lobster ravioli (special of the day) and he liked it. Overall, I am happy with this time I come here.
author: Diem M.

description:
We started coming here when they opened.  While the service remains friendly and very attentive, the food has fallen off.  The pizza is good, but better pizza could come out of that great oven they have.  

The pasta was very disappointing.  The red sauces were all way too thick.  We could not help but think "seasoned tomato paste."  At the end of the day, the food is okay, but the prices are out of balance with the quality. 

We will not be returning.
author: Allen S.

description: Absolutely delicious food and great customer service at a decent price point! 4 of us ordered the Uovo (egg pizza), rigatoni, and mushroom ravioli. Each dish was unique and fresh with varied flavors - a pleasant surprise! The portions were decently sized. Not massive, but enough so that 3 items for ~$16 each was quite filling. The chocolate soufflé and tiramisu were a great end to the meal.
author: Pranab S.

description: I had an early lunch here with a friend. We had lasagna and veal with apologies to vegans scallopini. The menu is diverse. This is probably the best restaurant in West Portal. West Portal is replete with restaurants, most of which are unremarkable. Convenient to Muni for the ambulatory. This is the local neighborhood for a large and diverse  population including St. Francis Wood, Pine Lake Park. San Francisco State is not far away. Same for famous Lowell High School.
author: Robert K.

description: This is a must if you're eating in West Portal. Actually if you're eating in San Francisco this restaurant can compete with any top rated restaurant in the City. The greeting at the door started a great dinning experience that can't be missed. The service excellent and the food amazing. The desert was delicious. I must mention again that the food equaled the service. If was a pleasure to be there. We walked in at 5:00 with six people and they sat us immediately and from that point in it was a great dinning experience. Trust me as a SF NATIVE, go to this restaurant.
author: Eric W.

description:
Perfect place to dine out with your family. The restaurant felt authentically Italian and their dishes were indeed delicious. 

I initially wanted a gnocchi and the server suggested I try out the handmade fiocchetti in pear Gorgonzola sauce. He said if I didn't like it, he'd replace it with what I did want. I initially hesitated but decided to go with it and ended up enjoying it. The pasta was fresh and sauce was deliciously creamy and blended well with the non-overpowering pear flavors. 

Service was friendly. We were seated near the front of the restaurant and they kept a good watch on our table. The owner checked in with us to ensure we were okay. 

Arrive early if you're planning dinner here. The place was filling up pretty fast and by the time we left a queue had accumulated outside.
author: Esther A.

description: The pizza here has an amazing crust! It's light but substantial/satisfying. Hard to describe, so you need to try it! We also had the salmon bruschetta that was compromised of smoked salmon, cream cheese, lemon, capers and mustard. I could probably eat it every day, it was so good! Comfortable setting. Good customer service. Highly recommend.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
We've  came to this place twice before, and although we know it's a bit pricey we've always been happy with the service and food. However, this recent time I felt extremely gypped. I normally get the Handmade Porcini Mushroom Ravioli with the truffle sauce which is incredible. However, I've been trying to lay off the carbs and eat healthier. As our waiter told us the specials for the night and one of them was a lemon sea bass with potatoes and asparagus, which sounded  great. Little did I know, the lemon sea bass was two pan fried filets with a lemon wedge on the side -__-. Not at all what i expected. The sea bass was bland and had no taste to it at all. The asparagus was just cooked with olive oil, no salt or pepper to it. The dish as a whole was just tasteless and I could have probably cooked A better version of it at home. So I asked for extra lemons to squeeze on the fish and some Parmesan cheese and pepper to give it some taste, which helped a lot. However, it was $30 for a tasteless dish! 

So, I definitely recommend to just stick to the pastas and the ravioli in truffle sauce!
author: Dianna C.

description: Fabulous food, wonderful staff, and great location.  Have been here several times and always have a great meal.  The food is very authentic Italian where you can actually taste the different ingredients and savor them.  Unlike most American "pizzas" the ones here are simple, thin, and yet full of flavor.  They don't drown their food in sauces and cheeses, but rather balance everything so you get the most from every bite.  The staff is always attentive and professional, even when they are super busy and people are waiting to be seated.  One of those little gems in West Portal that make living in that neighborhood a true treat.
author: Sean M.

description: Great authentic Italian food and loves the rigatoni, pizza, and definitely coming back soon.
author: Raj P.

description: This place had the ambience and the food quality. I felt like trying a new restaurant for soup and salad. The caprese was delicious, the cheese was very fresh. The minestrone had the home style feeling. The lobster ravioli was delicious but the 3 cheese pasta was on another level. Great dining experience.
author: andres c.

description: Quaint and perfect. Lovely atmosphere and excellent service. Parking could be tough but we lucked out and had a spot right in front on the street. Loved it! We ordered the Gnocchi  short rib.
author: Ellis H.

description:
Service- 5 stars
Food- 3 stars
Dessert- 2 stars
The details: service was great, attentive, friendly. Food sounded great and interesting on the menu, looked a bit small, but decent on the plate, but tasted mediocre. Beef short ribs with polenta were dry and both were bland. Spaghetti and meatballs- the meatballs were plain, and the sauce tasted straight out of the can. Dessert looked ok. The creme brulee cheesecake was the best tasting thing we got. It didn't have a candied sugar top, just tasted like vanilla bean, but was okay. The tiramisu had no alcohol in it, but instead the ladyfingers seemed soaked in water....maybe the cake had been frozen. Everything tasted like it was prepared a few days ago and frozen.
author: Kris F.

description:
The best Italian restaurant we found in town. The place is family friendly and the service fun, courteous and effective.

Foodwise, we usually stick to our favorites: bruchettas, the lamb chops + gnocchis (often here as a special) are absolutely wonderful, parmigiana fantastic, pizzas are good.
The homemade tiramisu is a sure value too.
author: Guillaume B.

description: This was a great experience ... the food was exceptional.  I had the lasagna while my boyfriend had the ravioli.  From the bread, prosciutto bruschetta, entrees to dessert it was all enjoyable.  Highly recommend and would dine here often if we lived here.
author: Dawn T.

description:
I live in Redwood City and drove to this restaurant twice in one week. Need I say more!?!?

Both times I had the Veal Scaloppini for dinner and the Tiramisu for dessert. I cant wait to go back to try other items on the menu. The Spaghetti Carbonara looked amazing as it went by to another table.

Trattoria da Vittorio has a very casual and comfortable setting. The service and food are excellent, and authentic. We were even visited by the owner himself. He checked in on us and had a good conversation, I loved this personal touch by Vittorio.
author: chris c.

description: Do not miss the Fiochetti pasta with gorgonzola sauce! The bruschetta with fresh mozzarella and prosciutto is also super good. They were really busy last Sunday so I had to wait a little bit extra to get my pasta but it was well worth it.
author: David D.

description: Quality of food was excellent (eggplant parmesan) and cesar salad, but price was a little high for what was received.  No pasta with eggplant and no butter with stale bread.  I was 5 minutes late for the take-out pick up time, and the food was barely warm.
author: Nami M.

description: Came here on a Saturday night with my favorite guys. We got here around 8:45pm and the wait was about 10-15 minutes which is not bad at all. Parking was easy to find since it's later at night. We ordered a bunch of food and they were all tasty! Service was a bit slow in my opinion. No one came to our table till 10 minutes and we were just wondering when someone would come up to us but they were just standing around. But luckily someone came by and took our order. We started with the calamari and the funghi brushetta. The calamari was delicious and it also came with fried artichoke. The funghi brushetta was yummy too. I think they may have burnt the bread a bit but it was still good! For main dish, I ordered the pizza with the egg, my boyfriend ordered the handmade scialatielli pasta pescatora and my friend ordered the lasagna. Pizza was yummy! Had tons of topping and the egg on there was on point. I tried some of the lasagna and the scialatielli and they were flavorful and tasty. Our total bill was about $95 ish. I'll be back if I'm in the area.
author: Monica W.

description:
My gf and I decided to goto West Portal for Saturday brunch. After a disappointing survey of the prospects, we "settled" for this place. (I suppose a trattoria is not a breakfast place in my mind.)The breakfast selections are meager but what they offer was really good. 

Great value and  attentive service from everyone that worked here. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
author: Blixa S.

description: The atmosphere has a small town/ family run restaurant feel.  We ordered the caprese app and it was awesome! The meat main we ordered was pretty good and the pasta dish was just OK.  I wish i had ordered a different past dish - but this was my fault....  The caramel ice cream was as good as others have noted in other reviews.
author: Erich B.

description: This review is long overdue.  I've been coming here since I started working at another local business early in 2014.  It has been consistently excellent in every way.  Delicious food, healthy portions and beyond amazing service.  Vittorio and his staff provide the best customer service in town; I always leave here feeling like I got special attention.  Trattoria da Vittorio is a shining example of how a restaurant should operate.
author: Beth D.

description:
Being new to the area, I depend on my few friends up here to introduce me to new areas within San Fran. Last night was West Portal and I loved it there. We had no place in mind for dinner so we decided to walk around the area and see what calls out to us...well, that and my handy yelp app which helped to suade us. The 4.5 average star rating at Trattoria Da Vittorio got my curiosity going so we walked by and loved the ambiance and we all agreed immediately if the wait wasn't long, it was meant to be.

We were there last night around 8:30pm (Thursday) and got seated at the bar within 10 minutes The wait would have been much longer for a tabletop but we were starving.  The first thing that stood out was that all the workers were Italian. BIG PLUS.  At first the smell of the restaurant bothered me and my friend said it was the yeast for the bread. 2nd BIG PLUS.  I love freshly made food.  

Now what to order?!?  Everything on the menu sounded incredible. With it being October, there were a few pumpkin inspired dishes such as their risotto and soup. But, i wasn't feeling it. I scrolled through the pictures on yelp and their homemade pasta looked good, I decided on the seafood pasta dish (Handmade Scialatielli pasta Pescatora  with fresh mix seafood in a tomato sauce  for $19)                My friends had the Lasagna and the Spaghetti with Meatball.  Though I enjoyed my seafood pasta dish, it was a little too fishy for me but hey, it's what I ordered.  The Lasagna was my favorite, if ever am I craving a Lasagna, I'm heading to this place.  The meatballs that came with the spaghetti ranks up as one of my faves.  

-Seafood Pasta - 4 star
-Spaghetti with Meatball - 4 star
-Lasagna - 5 star

Oh, I forgot to mention we started with the Calamari which was legitimate. Their mint dipping sauce wasn't my favorite. i preferred the other sauce but wished the regular marinara was provided.

When I go to an Italian place with legitimate food, I always order dessert. We were torn on what to get. Of course Tiramisu is always the go-to dish but the Homemade Profiterole (cream puff filled with ice cream instead of whipped cream) looked so interesting. We asked the server about the 2 options but we decided to play it safe and get the Tiramisu.  Well...to our surprise he brought u the Profiterole for us to try (on the house) which brought a smile to all our faces. These guys are 4.5 stars on Yelp for a reason! Nice! Both desserts were excellent, I can't decide which I enjoyed more, they were very different and both will not disappoint. 

At the end of our night, the bill was $100 for 3 people. The portions were super generous so we had 3 boxes of food to go. 1/2 of 2 entrees and 1/3 of the appetizer so I feel their pricing was very good. The food quality is excellent but the standout for this place is the wonderful service. 

Note that this is a true Italian establishment where you eat a nice and slow dinner. So service may seen slow but in actuality, this is how it is meant to be. This is not a place to rush a meal, rather this is a great place to catch up with friends and spend a good few hours mingling and enjoying great Italian cuisine/wine.
author: Mel D.

description:
Like some others, I have mixed feelings about this place.  As a mature customer (OK, we're senior citizens), it's not really a place that my wife and I enjoy.  But our son (in his early 40's) loves it.  It's too crowded and noisy for us to enjoy.  There does seem to be a great variety of dishes, and I would think foodies would really enjoy it.  Also younger people in a celebratory mood will probably enjoy the high energy in this restaurant.  The food is interesting and varied.  However I can't say I've had anything that has so much taste that I feel like "Gee, I want to come back and have that again!"

I also feel that it's a bit pricey.  For the same money I'd prefer to go to Gold Mirror and have an elegant, quiet and outstanding meal.  But then I'm an old fart.  I think younger people will find this a fun place.
author: Bob S.

description: Came in on a Saturday evening, got seated quickly before the dinner rush. Food and service was great! Definitely will come back.
author: Thanh V.

description:
A few days ago my friend and I had lunch here based on yelp ratings.

Unfortunately for us, the 4 stars definitely were not representative for us based on the food.
We both didn't really care for the food.
He had lasagna which he wasn't able to finish.  It just didn't appeal to us.
I tried a sandwich and it was just ok.

No issues with service, though it took a while for the food to come out.

In our opinion they need to step it up with the food quality.  We were sadly disappointed.
author: Eleanor L.

description: Awesome neighborhood restaurant. Cool Calabrian influence (NDUJA!) -- great differentiator from other spots. Wish it were even more pronounced. Authentic, carb-focused, stick to your ribs Italian. Short ribs and veal were fantastic. Place was cozy and bustling.
author: Andrew K.

description: Excellent food and service! They have a variety of bruschetta and I couldn't decide which to try; our server Matteo suggested making a plate with all of them to try. Delicious! Also try the Brussels sprouts with Gorgonzola!
author: Katie P.

description:
This place is fine Italian cuisine that is truly authentic! Food ranging from appetizers to main dishes to desserts were all delicious and finely presented with fair-sized proportions. Wait staff and waiter were all very attentive and friendly, and they know just the right timing when to take your plates away and fill up your waters.

Even waiter gave us two complimentary desserts (tiramisu) because we ordered 4 different varieties, but he said we didn't order 'his favorite' which was the Tiramisu. We were flattered by his gesture! 

Prices range from $15-30 which is on the moderate side but it is so worth it due to authenticity! Prices also go up with 'wine by the glass' selection too.

The only reason why I took away one star is because you can't make any reservations in advance (esp. if you have a party of 6 or more), so it's hard to say how long you have to wait for a table, and parking on West Portal is challenging, so that you have to go to residential side to secure a parking space.

Although there are small inconveniences above, I would definitely come back and proudly recommend this place to anyone!
author: Vanessa B.

description: What a great evening. The staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. Friendly and professional. The food was excellent -- from the wonderful caprise with those great tomatoes snd beautiful mozzarella through lasagna, veal, rigatoni -- and the carbonara (my favorite) with a perfectly cooked fried egg on top of a pile of incredibly delicious spaghetti. It was a celebration of my 69th birthday and my sister-in-law's 71st, and it was most memorable.
author: Dennis D.

description: The food and service are the epitome of perfection.  Everything is super fresh, cooked expertly and the service is divine.  We had the Caprese salad which had burrata that was so fresh it melted in your mouth.  We also had the gnocchi with tomato sauce- these pillows of heaven are incredible and the tomato sauce superb.  The branzini fish special was SPECTACULAR!  Beyond fresh and delicious!  This is one of the best of the best in SF
author: Samantha B.

description: Happy customer here everyone was super friendly and made our brunch perfect. Good was on point as well and endless mimosas
author: DUN UP B.

description:
Everything was great except the sassy host. 
Service, food, you name it. I had the lamb special for myself and it was insanely delicious. Lots of different flavors and a real taste of (what I think) Italy

Beware, the bathrooms can get kinda crowded in the tiny space!
author: Jenny W.

description:
This was my second visit to Trattoria da Vittorio
First time - Chicken panini with sautéed spinach and buffalo mozzarella it was fantastic. Today I had the Eggplant Parmesan which I could not stop eating. My friend had the  petrale sole - it was cooked perfectly.  Needless to say we enjoyed our food. This is my new favorite Italian resturaunt. Staff is friendly, food came quickly and hot. So far my experiences here have been great.
author: Janet C.

description:
Super Quick.Easy.friendly.... but not very tasty. Our check was $60 for the wild sea bass + and lasagna + glass of falanchina. 
P.S. not coming back
author: Sasha S.

description: This is our go-to Italian place in our neighborhood. They are always super busy, but always take great care of us. We especially appreciate Giovanni who has introduced us to many dishes and wine we would not order otherwise. One such suggestion is the pear and Gorgonzola fiochetti pasta served with hot chili oil on the side. Such a perfect balance of flavored! It's very rich so I recommend splitting the dish. We also love their Caesar salad which is served with a few anchovies. Great eating! Grazie!!
author: Bella L.

description: Noisy, rushed and rude. More like a sports bar than fine dinning.  DON'T BOTHER!  We thought that this would be a nice place for a nice romantic dinner for our anniversary. Boy were we wrong. Kids running all over, waiters yelling over our shoulders. So disappointing. How do they stay in business? Don't believe the hype.
author: Les T.

description:
This place was amazing. We sat outside, and they have heaters to keep you warm. The staff was very professional and attentive without becoming annoying by checking in on you every five minutes. 
I ordered a pizza:
Bella ~ burrata, prosciutto, arugula, eggplant, artichoke, zucchini\
Delicious! I used to go out of my way to get a great pizza in North Beach (think Tony's New York Style or similar). No more. The presentation was great, the crust was perfect, thin with a good char. The burrata was amazing! I've only had burrata this good at one other place (which also made their own). 

My gf ordered the risotto special with salmon and asparagus. 
Excellent, though not the type of risotto you'd expect from past experience, this dish was a direct contrast to the pizza, light texture, light flavors, not too salty. The rice was not cooked for a long time in the broth like most other risotto's you'd order would be, but instead it seems like they simmered it in the broth for a little while and then served it so that the rice absorbed the flavors but didn't release a lot of starch. Perhaps it's a southern Italian style of risotto, or the type of rice they used, I'm not sure. Just don't expect the same creamy dish that one tends to think of when ordering risotto. 

We finished off with the caramel gelato with salt and olive oil. 
Also amazing. Yes, it sounds strange, but the olive oil actually plays off and balances the sweetness in a pleasant way, as does the (very light dusting of) salt. So far this is the only gelato I have found in the U.S. that compares with the gelato in Italy. Almost every other place that has what they call gelato serves ice cream. This was the rich, dense, extremely creamy texture that I remember.
author: Mikkel R.

description:
I give it five starts because of course no restaurant is perfect, but the food quality and the service was very good and I would definitely come again. 

To begin with the food was simply delicious. You can taste the freshness of the pasta on the first bite. I've never had homemade pasta before and this just sets the standards very high for me for the next time I have pasta. Me and my friend shared the seafood pasta and they had it ready for us in two plates, nicely arranged, like if we just ordered it without it being split into two. The calamari was very good as well with four people sharing it. So enough for a group of people to have  as an appetizer. In the end of our meal we got the tiramisu, on the house because it was my friends birthday and it was one of the best tiramisu I've ever had! 

For the service: we got seated in five minutes on a weekend, so that was very fast. The owner of the place was so sweet and attentive. He actually made our order for us since he saw that we were ready to order. They were all very nice. Although one down side was that they accidentally gave our order to the table sitting next to us and we had to wait a little bit more longer, they were all very apologetic and showed that they cared about the customer.  When we were leaving we actually had a talk with the owner asking us how we liked the food. I've never really experienced an owner of a restaurant talking to me so I liked the conversation we had with him a lot. He told us how the restaurant started with his mom cooking in the kitchen so you know their whole menu is authentic Italian. It seemed that all the waiters were Italian because of their accents. And not to mention their waiter skills. Our waiter actually carried 5 plates on his forearm and didn't struggle at all. That was quite impressive.  The owner just told us that their first year just came up and I was quite shocked how recent they opened up this place. 


I give it five stars in the end because the food was sooo good. The servers were nice and attentive. Although the restaurant is kind of loud, but what do you expect with a busy restaurant? I would definitely want to come here again for a celebration or a nice fancy dinner.
author: Leslie F.

description:
Possibly one of the best Italian restaurants in the city. It's a bit out of the way for most, but worth driving there because the food and atmosphere are incredible. 

The service is also extremely good with several of the waiters able to speak Italian. Haven't had a chance to try their pizzas but all the pastas and main courses are first class
author: Marcus P.

description: It's probably the best restaurant for a family time. The owner and the waiters make this restaurant feel like you are in a Family in Italy, really amazing family friendly ambiance !  If your kids ask attention, they will make them have fun and they will consider them so much, that your kid will suddenly act like you expect in a restaurant. If you want to celebrate a birthday, they will sing for you ! If you feel alone, they will make you feel home. I'm french and my grand ma' Italian. My mum and my grand ma visiting from France at 95 years old came often with me in this restaurant. They were so thoughtful with my grand ma, they really really touch my heart.
author: Frederique C.

description:
I've been eyeing this place for awhile and my family and I decided to try Trattoria Da Vittorio for dinner. They've recently opened in the last year or so in the old Cafe For All Seasons spot, which is in the middle of West Portal. On a Sunday night, it was pretty busy but we were able to snag a table right away.

Their menu consists of more southern Italian fare, which is a welcome change since many Italian restaurants specialize in more northern Italian dishes. I ordered the gnocchi with pomodoro sauce and it was pretty good. The gnocchi were light and fluffy, like they should be, and the sauce was amazing. My mom ordered the San Daniele pizza, which comes with prosciutto, arugula, tomatoes and mozzarella. It reminded me of pizza I had in Florence - thin and crispy. My sister had a bowl of their tomato soup and a Caesar salad, which I had a few bites of. If you like traditional Caesar salad, anchovies and all, you'll like this one. We each ordered one of their desserts; I had the apple tart which was just enough for one person. Aside from the tart, it came with some ice cream - definitely a good choice if you want something sweet but isn't huge portions. 

Service was very attentive and our food came out in a timely manner. They were really busy but still made sure to check in on us and make sure our food was okay. 

I think the only reason that would keep me from coming back is the fact that their food is a little pricey. However, this is a great option if you're in West Portal and want some traditional Italian food in a comfortable, family-friendly setting.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Blew me out of the water. Now I try to never give 5 stars because there is always room for improvement... I tried to nit pick everything I could and before I could open my mouth any issue was resolved. Food is divine I feel like my own Nonna would be proud. Staff had the perfect Italian qualities, of "Every one is family" god bless them and I hope they always do this welll!!!!!!
author: Devin R.

description:
Lentil soup was the "homemade soup of the day". It was hearty and delicious.
We added a Margherita pizza with pepperoni and a specialty dish of breaded and fried chicken breast with eggplant parmigiana.
I asked for a side of spaghetti which they gladly included at no charge.
Our server also brought us a slice of tiramisu for dessert on the house.
Their pizza is excellent.  Service was great.  Loved the eggplant parmigiana. Fried chicken breast?.....not so much.
author: Thomas D.

description:
Stopped by here on a whim and very happy I did so. Food was excellent! Will definitely be coming back for more. The olive oil the use when you get the bread was amazing, real tasting oil! I had the mushroom and truffle sauce ravioli and was delighted that the truffle flavor was genuine and subtle. 
 Met the owner and he was very nice and really passionate about his food and greatful of peoples appreciation his food.

I can't wait to go back!
author: aaron t.

description: So shocked that we just found out about this little gem in West Portal area. I don't know where to start. Came here on a Saturday night with no reservations, it was so busy, but we got seated in less than 10 minutes,thanks to the host/owner who was very welcoming and helpful. Let's move on to meeting our charming server Roberto who gave us theeee best Italian dinner experience ever. If you are in dilemma, just ask him and he will definitely give you an honest opinion and better food preference. We got the truffle risotto, rigatoni with meatballs on the side (mouthwatering), zupa lentil soup and assorted cured meat plate. All freakin delicious, our favorite was the truffle risotto and meatballs. Then here comes dessert. You must get the Nuttelino and the Caramel Sea Salt and Olive Oil Gelato (we got a mini scoop as complimentary because Roberto is just awesome) I am very pleased about the experience I had and I will definitely come back again. The place is great for family dinners and also a perfect place to bring in your date. I highly recommend for you to try this place!
author: Gwen M.

description: Great food and just as great service. The waiters are so sweet and amicable. Not to mention the food is absolutely amazing. I take a lot of my friends from out of town here (vegetarian friends have loved this place!). From the eggs benedict to the pesto gnocchi, you really can't go wrong.
author: Sana A.

description:
This is a hidden gem in San Fran. Tourist won't find this place easily if they stay in the tourist areas. We had a rental car during part of our trip and made our way here, on accident. If back in the Bay area I would go here again over being in the heart of the 1000s of tourist and mediocre food. 

Waitstaff was attentive and super friendly, place does get really busy during peak dining times. All of the food from the pasta to the appetizers (especially the different types of brushetta) are top notch. We ate so much we couldn't try one of the wonderful desserts we saw being set down at other tables. Those patrons looked to be in heaven. 

We will be back.
author: Susan H.

description:
my friends and I had an issue with the food, but it was immediately resolved to our satisfaction. 

the owner of the restaurant cares about his customers and providing a good experience. 

excellent service and staff.
author: Bernard R.

description:
Came for dinner again while my mom was in town. She kept raving about their stacked high pepperoni pizza but this restaurant was one let down after the other! 

Our quoted 35 minute wait turned into 60 minutes while we watched at least 8 tables who arrived after us get seated before us. The hostess kept saying she was waiting for this family to clear out and the table would be ours AND THANK GOD the manager or whoever seated us shortly after because that family never left! We would've been waiting for an additional 35 minutes+ Ridiculous. 

The busboy was on point and even reminded someone when he noticed our appetizers never came. When they finally did, the waiter dropped two of our broccoli rage bruschetta and said he would come back with more. I wish he hadn't since it was fucking disgusting! Literally the worst bruschetta no wait literally one of the worst foods in general I've ever ordered in a restaurant. The bruschetta was a joke. 

The eggplant parmesan was massive and way overpriced. The pizza was good but it was maybe 1/3 of the amount of pepperoni we got the first time we were here (read: inconsistent). At one point they dimmed the lighting for some mood lighting BUT IT WAS WAY TOO DARK. wtf. get your shit together. 

This place is dead to me.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
There's fresh...

Pappardelli...
Gnocchi... 
Scialatielli...

There's homemade...

Tomato sauces...
Meatballs...
Eggplant Parmigiana...

COME N GET IT!!!

Sweety and I came here Sunday evening for dinner. Generally, the parking in this area sucks because 

1. Its West Portal.
2. Everyone eats out or is watching a movie.
3. Its Sunday. 

Luckily, we found someone leaving their parking spot, so we nabbed it. When we came into the restaurant, it was already bustling with people eating dinner and having a good time. We decided it would be best to sit at the counter instead of waiting an hour for a table. SCORE! 

We were seated within the first five minutes next to a column. I think its better to sit at the counter with my sweety, since being at a table divides us farther apart. Who agrees with me?! Being at the counter at Trattoria Da Vittorio is amazing because we could observe how the restaurant functions. This restaurant has an open aired kitchen where people at the counter could observe the kitchen staff working while the wait staff run around delivering piping hot savory meals to our tables. 

I ordered the Handmade Scialatielli pasta Pescatora with fresh mix seafood in a tomato sauce.The melding of the spices and sweet tomatoes in the sauce combined with the saltiness from the mollusks created an explosion of flavor in my mouth as I devoured my food. If I added Parmesan cheese to this delicate dish, it would have changed my palate and this review. Taking a sip of wine in between bites helped amplify the flavor of my food and the atmosphere (or, maybe because I may have been getting buzzed too). I didn't know what wine went well with this dish, so I asked the server to recommend one that was smooth, had a good fragrance, and full bodied; I had a Pinot Noir (Meiomi California 2011). I'm glad our server helped me pick a wine, otherwise I may have ordered one which could have destroyed the my appetite! 

Sweety had the Pappardelle con cinghiale wild boar ragu. Amazingly, she devoured her food in a blink of an eye. Must have been that tasty?! We sampled each others dishes and both were delicious! Pappardelle pasta were like thin ribbons wrapped around my fork which skewered a piece of wild boar. Wild boar was well marinated and cooked thoroughly. It was a bit gamey tasting, but hey, it was to be expected right? 

The evening winded down with dessert. We shared a Tiramisu and a Nutellino (a homemade calzone stuffed with nutella chocolate). Nutellino was really good because of the oozing magma hot nutella chocolate and the light fluffy crust of the calzone. Loved it! However, the Tiramisu was mediocre because it looked like it was hastily made. It fell apart too quickly. Could be the batch or something. Either way, it was tasty and ended up like everything else in my tummy. Seriously, I think I became a fatass in evening. BUT IT WAS ALL WORTH IT! 

Ah, now the SERVICE. 

Service was..

was...

SERVICE WAS AWESOME! 
Our servers were quick with catering to our customerly requests (knowledge of wines, dessert menu, bill). From the kitchen, we had some interaction with the head chef and the general manager too. I sometimes have this clueless look or bored expression on my face when I'm digesting. I guess my expression attracted the owner very quickly. He was directing his chef with something right across from me in the kitchen and upon looking up, he noticed me drifting off into space. Thanks for the service Mr. D'Urzo, much appreciated!

CONCLUSION:

This is probably my 5th or 6th time coming here and I always seem to forget to review it until NOW! I highly recommend this place for a small family/friend get together or for a date. The atmosphere is very intimate since the lights in here are often dimmed to provide that cozy romantic setting. The wait staff and kitchen staff speak very fluent Italian and Spanish. You can distinguish the kitchen staff pretty well as the Hispanics are either line cooks or dish washers who wear black, while the sous chef and executive chef wear white. 

I think the food is top notch, fresh and very flavorful. Will come again in the future. 

Bon Appétit!
author: Jason C. J.

description:
I'm honestly surprised at how terrible the whole thing was. 

When we got there, there was only a 10 minute wait. The bus boy came with water and filled up the glass only about a third of the way which left us surprised and laughing. That was a first.

The waiter finally came and we ordered several items: Bruschetta sampler, caprese salad, seafood risotto, gnocchi, wild boar ragu with pappardelle and Brussels sprouts. The bruschetta sampler came out first and that was actually decent. It just went downhill from there. I also ordered a soda and I had to repeatedly ask for it. 

Then all the food came and I mean all of it. The waiter was told that the 4 of us were going to do this family style so when all 5 dishes came at the same time, I was a bit surprised and irritated. Not only was the table small so had issues fitting everything and therefore felt cramped, but you just can't get to everything quick enough so things were getting cold. Also, who the hell brings out a salad with all of the entrees? That shout have come out with the Bruschetta.

That wasn't even the worst part. The food was terrible! The caprese salad had no olive oil on it nor salt and pepper so it was really bland. The risotto tasted like mush. It's pretty sad that an Italian restaurant doesn't know how to cook risotto properly. The pappardelle and and gnocchi were tasteless as well. The pasta clearly is not fresh. 

Overall, we were so disappointed in this meal. Not only was the service bad but the food was even worse. We didn't even stay for dessert. I won't be returning ever.
author: Diane M.

description: I can't even believe how good this food was! Hands down, it was the best Italian food I've had since being in Italy. And the service was wonderful! Our waiter was attentive and charming and gave a great wine suggestion. Try the lasagna! And the pizza was just like you'd get in Italy!
author: Brittany B.

description:
It's amusing how consumer-oriented this place is, like a very high-end McDonalds.  They have clearly optimized the space to fit as many tables as possible (it can be *very* loud), and the food comes out far too quickly (less than 5 minutes).  Every entree comes on the same square plate, and the waiters say things like "I've sold a lot of the pizza today."  Our waiter seemed annoyed when we wanted to add an appetizer because I guess he wanted to get us out of there and it would have ruined the customer turnover time. 

The food is satisfactory (especially anchovies on bruschetta), but seems too clean and consumer-oriented.
author: Katherine Y.

description:
Where delicious, authentic, Italian cuisine coexists with a welcoming energy produced by the tight-knit collection of employees, who treat their guests as though they are so much more than a mere customer. 
The bread to start with, could fill you up if you don't moderate how much you're eating, and moderation seems hard to control when it's just so good.
As for the menu; well, it contains a variety of delectable Italian entrees ranging from my personal favorite, the Veal Scaloppini plate, to a diverse selection of Pastas and Pizzas. 
In addition to the well respected menu, the positive, friendly vibe given off by the waiters provokes a comfortable and pleasant experience which amounts to a marvelous night. 
Great for a date of any kind, or a classy "bro's night out," sitting bar-side watching the game.
author: Tyler B.

description:
Spaghetti meatballs: meatballs were too dry and the tomato sauce was too sour.
Spaghetti carbonara: bacon was mainly fat, and weird too have a sunny side up egg on top of it.
author: Cedric M.

description:
I was extremely disappointed with the food.

The only thing that was good was the bruschetta sampler ($20). The risotto of the day ($20) was really bland and not cooked properly. Proper risotto should spread on a plate, this was more like a clump of mushy rice. The seafood that was in it was clearly from the freezer. After having a few bites of the gnocchi ($17), I feel like I was just stuffing my mouth with raw dough. The wild boar ragu with pappardelle ($17) was too acidic. It needed fat and possibly more cooking time to bind and balance out.

The dishes were not coursed out correctly either. The caprese salad ($10) came out at the same time as everything else.

The people were nice but it's not enough to make up for the bad food.

Spiazzo a block down is a better choice.
author: Andy W.

description:
It's funny when my Italian friend came to sf for visit, all he asked for is Italian food. 

What? Really? So I just show him a list of restaurants on yelp and he scanned though the list of highly rated italian restaurants nearby. A lot of them he said are not authentic just based on how they name their restaurants. (I was being skeptical as I thought you can never tell the quality of food by the names of the restaurants) 

Trattoria Da Vittorio was his final decision, and he's right! It's owned by real italian. Vittorio is super nice and my friend had a wonderful time chatting with him.

The pizza is delectable!!! and I don't even remember the name of it. As you know my friend ordered everything for us. Thin crust, with very fresh and high quality mozzarella... and salumi on top..... so yummm... 

For dessert we had the tiramisu with a small cup of espresso. The tiramisu is a must I would say... a nice finish of the meal.

Highly recommend this place! :)
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
20 min wait on a Monday for overcooked Italian food ): 
My table got pesto gnocchi, 3 cheese gnocchi, and marinara gnocchi. They probably should have got some variation in dishes because no one ate more than half of theirs, and each plate was $15+. It was sloppily displayed, mushy, and overly milky sauce. I got tomatoes, basil, and Gorgonzola for starter and the tomatoes were too unripe/hard to eat so everyone just left them untouched. I had the White bean soup which was decent, but I wouldn't get it again. 
The atmosphere was okay and it was pretty packed for a Monday night - but 1/2 the other places in west portal are closed on Mondays so.. The service was okay too, we had to ask for more bread, water, and the check but they were overly enthusiastic and Italian when we asked so whatever. The bill ended up to be $100 for 4 people and everyone was still starving when we left.
author: Emma G.

description: Highly recommend this place the owner was very personable! Passionate about His food!!
author: Clint And Tammy B.

description:
I love West Portal, and i am so close. I also Love pizza so after seeing all the pictures and reviews i gave this place a try.

Came with a Party of 3,and there was a line and it was a cold Friday night. Waited 20 minutes after being quoted 10-15. All good because the service rocks. Not sure if it was the owner or manager but he came and gave us drink orders such as wine, and even some comp champagne for the ladies. 

Someone was giving out fresh baked bread as well. After being seated we ordered bruschetta borada which was awesome. The regular served bread was ok, but we did receive vinegar late. 

We ordered the lasagna, pizza, and another pasta dish. I loved my pizza and the mozzarella was awesome. I did try the lasagna which was super heavy and tasty, enough for two. We even got a nice small desert on the house. Maybe because we had to wait? maybe cause the service was just great. 

Good food, good service.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
As I write this review, I am sadden that i will no longer be visiting any more restaurants for the next couple of months due to my diet, but i am glad that my last carb worthy place was here. 

I heard about this place because my friends brought some leftovers one night and had some of the pizza and i was really impressed especially for a left over. I randomly decided to come here during lunch with a friend. The restaurant starts of casual in front and starts to become more classier as you move to the back. The staff were real italians with real accents haha and super friendly. 

I ordered the homemade spaghetti with seafood and my friend order the pizza with egg. We also ordered meat and cheese bruschetta. The bruschetta was so good, using prosciutto and Barada cheese topped off with olive oil. The cheese was fresh and the bread texture was just right they also had a side of arugula as well

My pasta was fresh, you can tell by the shape and texture. They used a little bit of a thicker shape a lot like udon but that was cool with me. The sauce was thick and flavorful - there was no watery sauce here.They had large shrimp, clams and fish as protein. One of the best pasta I've had next to Emmys. 

I only had a slice of the pizza, but i can tell that it had the same quality as something like Zero Zero, I personally wanted to try a red based sauce because he had a cream base sauce. 

Overall i really enjoyed myself here. Having the perfect balance of casual lunches and great dinner entrees. I will be back as soon as my diet allows it!
author: Ryan R.

description:
Amazing restaurant!  My friends and I were a party of seven, and we came last Saturday night. The place was busy but our waiter was very attentive, and the owner really seemed to care about all of his customers.  
The food was fantastic, from the bruschetta combination to the caprese, to the lamb, the fiochetti, the spaghetti carbonara (along with great wine, of course).  Everyone's meal was delicious. As for dessert - the limoncello cake, Nutella cannoli and salted caramel gelato were all amazing!  I will definitely be back with family members and cannot wait!
author: Kris M.

description:
I think I may have just found one of my new favorite Italian restaurants in the City.  Nuzzled right in the West Portal area, this little gem boasts authentic Southern Italian flavors with a warm and cozy atmosphere.  From the moment we walked in, we experienced excellent service that was genuine and inviting.  They really do make you feel like family here.  

I loved that all the servers spoke fluent Italian and recommended some of the yummiest dishes to us.  It just added to the experience with a touch of authenticity.  Our server was Alessandro and he made our dining experience impeccable.  He was quick, accommodating, and really friendly.  He knew we were eyeing the Pappardelle even before we said a word (he probably overheard our conversation ha!).  At the end of our meal, I was debating whether or not to order the tiramisu (my FAVORITE dessert).  I decided against it to be slightly healthier (especially after eating pasta), but they presented us with one anyway.. ON THE HOUSE.  Aww... how can I refuse that?!  Just gotta work out that much harder tomorrow!  Indeed I was a very happy camper :)     

So in summary, the prices are very decent, the food was very flavorful and authentic, portions are large, and it's in a convenient location.  Parking may be a bit of an issue sometimes, but definitely not as difficult as some of the other neighborhoods in SF.  Again, I cannot stress how amazing the service was.  Often time the host/hostess is the first person you talk to when you get to a restaurant.  That short interaction can either make or break your experience there.  The owner, I believe, was the host/maître d' and he immediately made us feel very welcomed.  I noticed he was constantly walking around to each table to introduce himself and checking in to make sure the guests were accommodated.  And of course, I was very happy with the free tiramisu.  It was perfectly moist and creamy.. oh it was heaven in my mouth.  

All in all, a very solid restaurant and I would highly recommend it for a casual yet intimate dining experience.
author: Cecilia S.

description: Consistently attentive service. Authentic Italian pizza, burrata, pasta. I love the whole experience. Ask for the caramel salted ice cream with olive oil. Omg it's sooooo good
author: Yelena K.

description:
I've been here twice as my and girl's favorite Italian date spot.  Both times we were met with outstanding customer service and fresh, authentic food.  Sit at the bar to ditch the line, and get a front view of the beautiful pizza oven  

We've had the gnocchi, the Ouvo pizza , and the Calzone.  The Ouvo is a MUST and by far my favorite. They crack a whole egg or two in the center of the pizza and cook it with the pizza until it's about over easy. Use the rest of the pizza almost like bread by sopping up all that runny egg, which combines pleasantly with the mozzarella, pancetta, and mushrooms.
author: Ronald T.

description:
Where do I begin... My friend and I came here after church on Ash Wednesday mass looking for some meatless dishes. We ordered the calamari, which to me was great because it also came with artichoke hearts. The marinara sauce was super bland and the tartar sauce, well... Needless to say it was likely from a jar. My friend ordered the risotto of the day and I ordered the Mushroom and black truffle ravioli. When the mains arrived at the table, it was very unappealing to the eye. The risotto was in the center of a square plate with five pieces of shrimp around the plate. Very boring presentation. The ravioli was a different story... I don't normally take photos of my food, but I just had to for this purpose. This is your cue to look at the photo I uploaded. 
Luckily, it tasted decent. However, if it was presented better, then I am sure it would have tasted better. I am not sure that I would come back here.
author: Dora Z.

description: The food and service is great! We love getting the spaghetti when we're craving for comfort food, but personally my favorite is their hand made Fiocchetti with their savory cream sauce which is perfectly contrasted with the sweet pears. The bread they serve is also delicious and we love that they don't skimp in that area. Unfortunately their desserts are lacking; their homemade creme brulee cheesecake tasted oddly dry and grainy, their tiramisu is too sweet, and their dark chocolate mousse cake is like the type you get at the local chain supermarket.
author: Soo L.

description:
I reaaaally do not like giving 2 stars but I somehow couldn't justify giving it a 3. Maybe a 2.5? I was surprised that I didn't enjoy this place since other reviewers seem to love it. Perhaps I am a little harsher on establishments in the city especially if other customers are rating it 4 stars.

Upon arriving, a server greeted me and then just walked away without clarifying what to do. I get that the restaurant is on the casual side, but I don't particularly like being left confused and ignored especially if I'm a first timer. Service thereafter was okay but you can tell the staff are somewhat distracted because they're really busy. 

I started out the night with the salmon bruschetta and was sorely disappointed. It tasted nothing more than butter and smoked salmon (the kinds you can get at Costco). They were two capers and drops of mustard as garnish, but I didn't think the flavors worked well together. Bread was kind of stale. For the main entree, I got the seafood pasta and my friend got the ravioli with truffle cream sauce. The pasta were all "handmade" but they didn't taste anything better than homecooked pasta. The pasta and seafood were overcooked, and the sauce left much to be desired, even the truffle ravioli! Really good pasta to me has a slight springiness and ingredients should taste fresh. All things considered, I think $18-20 for a dish here is quite steep.

My friends and I meant to meet to catch up but because it was so loud we could barely hear one another. I'm sorry to say I don't see the appeal of this place. Perhaps I should've gotten a pizza dish since people are raving about them, but you can get a much better experience elsewhere for the price point, ambiance, service, and food.
author: Ariel S.

description: What a gem! Found this place by accident on the way to a concert. The pizza was stacked with mushrooms and arugula and the crust was perfect! Great, cozy service and Vittorio was at the door as we left and greeted us so warmly!
author: Michele K.

description:
